silana: <entryFree id="n44232" type="main" key="Silana"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Silana</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n44232.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town of Thessaly</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
silanio: <entryFree id="n44233" type="main" key="Silani^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Silanĭo</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Silanĭion</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n44233.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a celebrated statuary</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:57:section=126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 57, § 126</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 8, 19, § 51</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 7</bibl>, praef.</sense></entryFree>
silanus: <entryFree id="n44234" type="main" key="Si_la_nus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sīlānus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n44234.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman surname in the Julian</hi> gens, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:2" default="NO" valid="yes">25, 2</bibl>. </sense><sense id="n44234.1" n="a" level="4"> D. Junius Silanus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:7:24" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 7, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:16:57" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 16, 57</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:4:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 4, 4, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 50:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 50, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:51:16" default="NO" valid="yes">51, 16</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n44234.2" n="b" level="4"> M. Silanus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:35:135" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 35, 135</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fan 10, 30</bibl>. 1.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sīlānĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">named from one Silanus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">senatusconsultum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:29:5:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 29, 5, 1</bibl></cit>, §§ 7 and 21.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n44235" type="greek" key="si_la_nus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sīlānus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">silhno/s</foreign>, Doric <foreign lang="greek">silano/s</foreign>, <sense id="n44235.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fountain</hi> or <hi rend="ital">jet of water</hi> (usually spirting from a head of Silenus). <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1265" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 1265</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 3, 18 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl>; Fest. s. v. tullios, p. 352 Müll.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3321</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 169" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 169</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
<entryFree id="n44236" type="main" key="Si_la_nus3" n="3"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sīlānus</orth>, v. Sila <sense id="n44236.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
silarus: <entryFree id="n44237" type="main" key="Si^la^rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sĭlărus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*si/laris</foreign>, <sense id="n44237.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a river forming the boundary between Lucania and Campania</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Sele</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 9, § 70</bibl> (al. Silerus) sq.; 2, 103, 106, § 226; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 146</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:582" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 582</bibl>.—Also called <orth extent="full" lang="la">Silerus</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:4:9" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 4, 9</bibl>; and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Siler</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:2:426" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 2, 426</bibl>; Col. poët. 10, 136.</sense></entryFree>
silatum: <entryFree id="n44238" type="gloss" key="silatum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">silatum</orth> <itype>antiqui pro eo, quod nunc jentaculum dicimus, appellabant, quia jejuni vinum sili conditum ante meridiem absorbebant</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=347" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 347</bibl> Müll.</entryFree>
silaus: <entryFree id="n44239" type="main" key="silaus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">silaus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n44239.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of parsley</hi>, <hi rend="ital">smallage</hi>: Apium graveolens, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 8, 56, § 88</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
silenicus: <entryFree id="n44240" type="main" key="Si_le_ni^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sīlēnĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>Silenus</etym>, <sense id="n44240.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">sacred to Silenus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">racemi (hederae),</quote> <trans><tr>a species of ivy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 34, 62, § 146</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
silens: <entryFree id="n44241" type="main" key="si^lens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĭlens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos> of sileo.</entryFree>
silenter: <entryFree id="n44242" type="main" key="si^lenter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĭlenter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. sileo, <sense id="n44242.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
silentiarius: <entryFree id="n44243" type="main" key="si^lenti^a_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĭlentĭārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>silentium</etym>. <sense id="n44243.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A confidential domestic servant</hi> (orig. watching for the domestic silence; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 47:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 47, 3</bibl>), Salv. Gub. Dei, 4, 3; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2956</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3193</bibl>; cf. Becker, Gallus, 2, p. 99 (2d. ed.).— </sense><sense id="n44243.1" n="II" level="1"> In the later imperial period, <hi rend="ital">a certain high officer at court</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a privy-councillor</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 3, 28, 30 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO">15, 62, 25</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3194</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
silentiose: <entryFree id="n44244" type="main" key="si^lenti^o_se_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĭlentĭōsē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. silentiosus <sense id="n44244.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
silentiosus: <entryFree id="n44245" type="main" key="si^lenti^o_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĭlentĭōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>silentium</etym>, <sense id="n44245.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perfectly still</hi> or <hi rend="ital">silent</hi>: nactus opacae noctis<cb n="SILE" />  silentiosa secreta, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 11</bibl> <hi rend="ital">init.—Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">sĭlentĭōsē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">stilly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">silently</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">silentiose geritur publicum bonum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 11, 1 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
silentium: <entryFree id="n44246" type="main" key="si^lenti^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĭlentĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>sileo</etym>. <sense id="n44246.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n44246.1" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">a being still</hi> or <hi rend="ital">silent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">noiselessness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stillness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">silence</hi> (freq. and class.; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">taciturnitas): otium et silentium est, Ter. Hec. prol. alt. 35: et ipse conticuit et ceteris silentium fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:35:143" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 35, 143</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 35, 160</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:38:64" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 38, 64</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">auditus est magno silentio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">silentio auditus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:19:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 19, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">huic facietis Fabulae silentium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:prol. 15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. prol. 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fac silentium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:3:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 4, 3, 50</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:28:59" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 28, 59</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec longa silentia feci,</quote> <trans><tr>kept silence</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:183" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 183</bibl></cit>: silentio facto, <hi rend="ital">silence being obtained</hi>, Quadrig. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:9:13:10" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 9, 13, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 14 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:5:6 al" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 5, 6 al.</bibl>; also with the signif. <hi rend="ital">to make</hi> or <hi rend="ital">procure silence</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Fabius cum silentium classico fecisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 45</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:10:6:3" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 10, 6, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:5:5:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 5, 5, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">facere silentia majestate manūs,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:4:7" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 4, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tribuni plebis, cum inviti silentium tenuissent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:9:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 9, 4</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">tenere silentium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:16:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 16, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:28:8" default="NO" valid="yes">1, 28, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:38:14" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 38, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">silentium obtinere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:16:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 16, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">obstinatum silentium obtinuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:38:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 38, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tenuere silentia cuncti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:206" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 206</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se silentium fieri jussisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:28:59" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 28, 59</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:298" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 298</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">silentium imperare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Vit. Beat. 26:7" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Vit. Beat. 26, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">silentium significare,</quote> <trans><tr>to give a signal for silence</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:84:290" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 84, 290</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum silentio animadvertite,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:prol. 44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. prol. 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Athenienses cum silentio auditi sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:10:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 10, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum silentio ad aliquem convenire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:35:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 35, 1</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">cum silentio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:9:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 25, 9, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agere per silentium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:prol. 36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. prol. 36</bibl></cit>; cf. id. Hec. prol. alt. 21; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:prol. 30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. prol. 30</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">per silentium noctis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:42:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 42, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 53</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego illas omnes res egi silentio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:12:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Prov. Cons. 12, 29</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut nulla fere pars orationis silentio praeteriretur,</quote> <trans><tr>in silence</tr>, <tr>without applause</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:22:88" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 22, 88</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">more freq.: praeterire silentio,</quote> <trans><tr>to pass over in silence</tr>, <tr>to say nothing about</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:21:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 21, 62</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,038:23:82" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Part. Or. 23, 82</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:13:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 13, 6</bibl> Orell. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.;</hi> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:20:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 20, 6</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">for which: silentio transire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:19:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 19, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:3:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 3, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:12:23" default="NO">5, 12, 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">periculosissimum locum silentio sum praetervectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:7:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 7, 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">transmittere aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 13 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> al.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum M. Tullius de omnibus (oratoribus) aetatis suae silentium egerit,</quote> <trans><tr>keeps silence</tr>, <tr>is silent</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:38" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tenere se intra silentium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:17:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 4, 17, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:6:6" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 6, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">de Partho silentium est,</quote> <trans><tr>nothing is said</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:16:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 16, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut laudem eorum a silentio vindicarem,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>obscurity</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 2, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 21:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 21, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:9:14:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 9, 14, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">gravissimas plagas ferre silentio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:20:46" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 20, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam maximum silentium haberi jubet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 99:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 99, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacrimae omnibus obortae, et diu maestum silentium tenuit,</quote> <trans><tr>prevailed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:8:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 8, 20</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: fer opem furtoque silentia deme, <hi rend="ital">remove silence from</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">tell of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disclose</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:700" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 700</bibl>.—Of the <hi rend="ital">stillness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">silence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dead</hi> of night: <cit><quote lang="la">silentio noctis Caesar ex castris egressus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in silentio noctis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 26</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">se vocem noctis silentio audisse clariorem humanā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paulo ante mediam noctem silentio ex oppido egressi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 11</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 18</bibl>; 7, 60; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:23:9:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 23, 9, 38</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, in <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">silentia noctis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:461" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 461</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:441" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 441</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid me alta silentia cogis Rumpere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 63</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:184" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 184</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">taciturna silentia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:585" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 585</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">torquent illum furibunda silentia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:10:890" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 10, 890</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">The stillness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quietness</hi> of the fields: <cit><quote lang="la">nactus silentia ruris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:232" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 232</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vidit desolatas agere alta silentia terras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:1:349" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 349</bibl></cit>.—Of wood that makes no noise, does not snap, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 16, 28, § 70</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44246.2" n="B" level="2"> In partic., in augural lang., <hi rend="ital">freedom from disturbance;</hi> hence, <hi rend="ital">faultlessness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perfectness</hi> in the taking of auspices: <cit><quote lang="la">id silentium dicimus in auspiciis, quod omni vitio caret, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:34:71" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 34, 71</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=348" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 348</bibl> Müll.; s. v. sinistrum, p. 351 ib.; and v. Becker, Antiq. vol. 2, pars 3, p. 76 sq.—</sense><sense id="n44246.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a standstill</hi> (opp. to motion or activity); <hi rend="ital">cessation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">repose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inaction</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tranquillity</hi>, etc. (rare but class.): mundus caeli vastus constitit silentio, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> 6, 2 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">silentium perpetuum judiciorum ac fori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:14:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 14, 32</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 39</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitam silentio transire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">silentium otiumque inter armatos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 45</bibl></cit>: biduum deinde silentium <pb n="1699" /> <cb n="SILE" /> fuit neutris transgredientibus amnem, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 37, 38</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">idem praeturae tenor et silentium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quantum distant a morte silentia vitae?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:145" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 145</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
silentus: <entryFree id="n44247" type="main" key="si^lentus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĭlentus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>sileo</etym>, <sense id="n44247.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">silent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quiet</hi>: loca, Laev. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:7:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 19, 7, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
silenus: <entryFree id="n44248" type="main" key="Si_le_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sīlēnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*seilhno/s</foreign>. <sense id="n44248.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Silenus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the tutor and constant attendant of Bacchus; represented as baldheaded</hi>, <hi rend="ital">with short horns and a flat nose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">as drunken</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lascivious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and mounted on an ass</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:239" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 239</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 6, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:543" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 543</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:399" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 1, 399</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 413</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 339</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 11, 90</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11, 99</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:48:114" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 48, 114</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 191" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 191</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sīlēni</orth>, <hi rend="ital">gods of the woods</hi>, <hi rend="ital">satyrs</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:252" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 252</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 10, 36, § 110</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. E. 6, 14</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44248.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A Greek historian</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:24:49" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 24, 49</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 49</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Hann. 13:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Hann. 13, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 22, 36, § 120</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sileo: <entryFree id="n44249" type="main" key="si^le^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĭlĕo</orth>, <itype>ŭi</itype> (<sense id="n44249.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf. pass.</hi> silitum est, Aug. Civ. Dei, 16, 2), <itype>2</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [cf. Goth. silan, ana-silan, to be silent; Germ. seltsam, selten], <hi rend="ital">to be noiseless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">still</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">silent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to keep silence; act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not to speak of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to keep silent respecting</hi> a thing (class.; stronger than tacere). </sense><sense id="n44249.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n44249.2" n="(a)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">silete et tacete atque animum advortite,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:prol. 3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. prol. 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:1:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 3, 1, 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">optimum quemque silere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 27 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">muta silet virgo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:389" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 389</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lingua, sile,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:2:2:61" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 2, 2, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sedentibus ac silentibus cunctis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:21" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obstrepentes forte ranas silere jussit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:94" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 94</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44249.3" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">de</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum ceteri de nobis silent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:29:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 29, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de dracone silet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:30:65" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 30, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de re publicā ut sileremus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:42:157" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 42, 157</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 76, 266</bibl>; cf. Fabri ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 19:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 19, 2</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Impers. pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">de jurgio siletur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 2, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:10:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Div. in Caecil. 10, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 2, 8</bibl>: usque ab Abraham de justorum aliquorum commemoratione silitum est, Aug. Civ. Dei, 16, 2.—</sense><sense id="n44249.4" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae hoc tempore sileret omnia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:6:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 6, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu hoc silebis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:18:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 2, 18, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque te silebo, Liber,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:12:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 12, 21</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 9, 31</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortia facta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:575" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 575</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alium silere quod voles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Hippol. 876" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Hippol. 876</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nulla me tellus silet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Oet. 39" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Herc. Oet. 39</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">facti culpa silenda mihi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:2:208" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 2, 208</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ea res siletur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod ego praetermitto et facile patior sileri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 1, 6, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne nunc quidem post tot saecula sileantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:10:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 10, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per quem tria verba silentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:47" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mala causa silenda est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:3:1:147" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 3, 1, 147</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quisquis ille, sileatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:8:22:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 8, 22, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 41</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Part. pass.</hi> as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">sĭlenda</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <hi rend="ital">mysteries</hi>, <hi rend="ital">secrets</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:10:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 10, 5</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:25:3" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 25, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44249.5" n="(d)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">rel.clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quā tulerit mercede, silet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:688" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 688</bibl></cit>.—* (<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">obj.-clause</hi>: ut sileat verbum facere, Auct. B. Hisp. 3, 7.—</sense><sense id="n44249.6" n="2" level="3"> Of things (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">intempesta silet nox,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:247" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 247</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">silet aequor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:9:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> E. 9, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:7:542" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 7, 542</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">immotae frondes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:187" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 187</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">umidus aër,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:21:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 21, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:25:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 25, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tranquillo silet immotāque attollitur undā Campus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 127</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">silent late loca,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 190</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempus erat quo cuncta silent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:446" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 446</bibl></cit>; cf. also infra <hi rend="ital">P. a.—Act.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si chartae sileant quod bene feceris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:8:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 8, 21</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44249.7" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to be still</hi> or <hi rend="ital">quiet</hi> (opp. to being in action), <hi rend="ital">to remain inactive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to rest</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cease</hi> (in class. prose, for the most part only of things; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">quiesco): et cycnea mele Phoebeaque Carmina consimili ratione oppressa silerent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:506" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 506</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">silent diutius Musae Varronis quam solebant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 1, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">silent leges inter arma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 4, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quando ambitus sileat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:17:39" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 3, 17, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne sileret sine fabulis hilaritas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 110, 6</bibl></cit>.—Of persons: <cit><quote lang="la">fixaque silet Gradivus in hastā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:4:281" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 4, 281</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec ceterae nationes silebant (with arma movere),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 47</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">sĭlens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype> (<case>abl.</case> silente; <cit><quote lang="la">but -ti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:35:18 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 35, 18 al.</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 84</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">neutr. plur.</hi> silenta loca, Laev. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:7:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 19, 7, 7</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">gen. plur.</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>) silentum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:432" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 432</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:356 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 356 al.</bibl>), <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">still</hi>, <hi rend="ital">calm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quiet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">silent</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nocte silenti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 84</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:527" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 527</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">silenti nocte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:5:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 5, 9</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">Petr. poët. 89, 2, 32: silente nocte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:5:16" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 5, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">silente caelo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:279" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 28, 69, § 279</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">silenti agmine ducam vos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 38</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">silenti agmine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 31, 38 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:4" default="NO" valid="yes">35, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">per lucos silentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:476" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 476</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vultu defixus uterque silenti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:7:407" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 7, 407</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">umbrae silentes,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the dead</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:264" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 264</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">called populus silens,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Rapt. Pros. 2, 237</bibl></cit>; more <cb n="SILI" /> freq. as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">sĭlentes</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>comm.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the dead</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">umbrae silentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:797" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 797</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">rex silentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:5:356" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 356</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sedes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:15:772" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 772</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:750" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 750</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Aeacus jura silentibus illic Reddit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 25</bibl></cit>.—The Pythagoreans were also called Silentes for the five years during which they were to listen to the instructions of Pythagoras: <cit><quote lang="la">coetus silentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 66</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">hence, silentes anni, these five years of the Pythagoreans,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Cons. Mall. Theod. 157</bibl></cit>: luna silenti, <hi rend="ital">not shining</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">at the end of the month</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 29</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">40</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">50</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:10:11" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 10, 11</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:190" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 39, 74, § 190</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sarmentum,</quote> <trans><tr>not yet shooting forth</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:29:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 29, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vineae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:27:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 27, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">surculi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 2, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:7:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 7, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ova,</quote> <trans><tr>in which the chicks do not yet move</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:5:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 5, 15</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">ab</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dies silens a ventis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:29:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 29, 5</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">sĭlenter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">silently</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Juvenc.</author> 3, 462</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> 1</bibl>, Reg. 24, 5.</sense></entryFree>
siler: <entryFree id="n44250" type="main" key="si_ler1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sīler</orth>, <itype>ĕris</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n44250.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of brook-willow</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 18, 31, § 77</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:73" default="NO" valid="yes">24, 10, 44, § 73</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 12</bibl> Serv.</sense></entryFree>
<entryFree id="n44251" type="main" key="Si^ler2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sĭler</orth>, v. Silarus.</entryFree>
silerus: <entryFree id="n44252" type="main" key="Si^le^rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sĭlĕrus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. Silarus.</entryFree>
silesco: <entryFree id="n44253" type="main" key="si^lesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĭlesco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n44253.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> [sileo], <hi rend="ital">to become still</hi>, <hi rend="ital">silent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">calm</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">quiet</hi> (rare; not in Cic.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn. obmutesco): dum hae silescunt turbae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 2, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deum domus alta silescit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 101</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caeli furor aequinoctialis Zephyri silescit auris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:46:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 46, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venti silescunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:2:151" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 2, 151</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
silex: <entryFree id="n44254" type="main" key="si^lex"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĭlex</orth>, <itype>ĭcis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and late Lat.; also <sense id="n44254.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fem.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 1, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:471" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 6, 471</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 602</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">8, 233</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:225" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 225</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">9, 304</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">9, 613</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 6, 16</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:6:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 6, 2</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">gen. plur.</hi> silicum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:683" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 683</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4:304" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 4, 304</bibl>) [root sar-, to be firm; cf.: solum, solidus]. </sense><sense id="n44254.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Any hard stone found in fields</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a pebble-stone</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a flint</hi>, <hi rend="ital">flint-stone</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">silicem caedere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:41:85" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 41, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">silice vias sternere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 41, 27</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:27:section=7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 41, 27, § 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">silici scintillam excudere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:174" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 174</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gravem medios silicem jaculatus in hostes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 139</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">per ampla spatia urbis, subversasque silices,</quote> <trans><tr>pavements</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 6, 16</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">silicem pedibus quae conteret atrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:350" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 350</bibl></cit>.— Freq. joined with lapis: <hi rend="ital">Ag.</hi> Illa mulier lapidem silicem subigere, ut se amet, potest. <hi rend="ital">Mi.</hi> Pol id quidem haud mentire: <cit><quote lang="la">nam tu es lapide silice stultior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:77 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 77 sq.</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 18, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 43</bibl>; Fest. s. v. lapidem, p. 115 Müll.; and in inscrr.: II VIRI VIAM LAPID(e) SILIC(e) STERN(endam) CVR(averunt), Inscr. Bull. dell' <bibl default="NO"><author>Inst.</author> 1839, p. 60</bibl>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 6617</bibl>.—With saxum: <cit><quote lang="la">porcum saxo silice percussit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 24 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> —To denote <hi rend="ital">hard-heartedness</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non silice nati sumus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:6:12" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 6, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec in tenero stat tibi corde silex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:1:64" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 1, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec rigidas silices in pectore gerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:614" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 614</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et dicam silices pectus habere tuum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:11:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 3, 11, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">moturaque duras Verba queror silices,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:304" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 9, 304</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44254.2" n="II" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">a rock</hi>, <hi rend="ital">crag</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:683" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 683</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">validi silices,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:571" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 571</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:449" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 449</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">stabat acuta silex praecisis undique saxis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:233" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 233</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nudus silex,</quote> <trans><tr>bare rick</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Phoen. 69" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Phoen. 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">excisae rupes durissimi silicis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:37" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juventus duris silicum lassata metallis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4:304" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 4, 304</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Lycius Phrygiusque silex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:2:148" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 2, 148</bibl></cit>.—Of <hi rend="ital">limestone</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 107</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:174" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 23, 53, § 174</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
silianus: <entryFree id="n44255" type="main" key="Si_li^a_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sīlĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Silius.</entryFree>
silicarius: <entryFree id="n44256" type="main" key="si^li^ca_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĭlĭcārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>silex</etym>, <sense id="n44256.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one that paves roads with pebble-stones</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a pavior</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Aquaed. 117" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Aquaed. 117</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 645</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
silicernium: <entryFree id="n44257" type="main" key="si^li^cerni^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĭlĭcernĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <sense id="n44257.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A funeral feast</hi>, Caecil. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=294" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 294</bibl> Müll.; Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 48, 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 8, § 805</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">Becker, Gallus, vol. 3, p. 296 (2d ed.).—Hence, a term of abuse applied to an old man: te exercebo hodie, silicernium,</quote> <trans><tr>drybones</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:2:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 2, 48</bibl></cit>; for which, in <hi rend="ital">masc.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">sĭlĭcernĭus</orth>, Cinc. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Fulg.</author> 560, 21</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44257.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A kind of sausage</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 7, 229</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
silices: <entryFree id="n44258" type="main" key="Sili^ces"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Silĭces</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n44258.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a mountain-tribe in Asia</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">montani,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 26, 30, § 118</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
siliceus: <entryFree id="n44259" type="hapax" key="si^li^ce^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĭlĭcĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>silex</etym>, <sense id="n44259.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of flint</hi> or <hi rend="ital">limestone</hi>, <hi rend="ital">silicious</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">saxa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:8:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 8, 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lapides,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 18, 3</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: cor, Laev. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:7:10" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 19, 7, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
silicia: <entryFree id="n44260" type="main" key="si^li^ci^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĭlĭcĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n44260.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">also called</hi> faenum Graecum, <hi rend="ital">fenugreek</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:140" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 16, 39, § 140</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:184" default="NO" valid="yes">24, 19, 120, § 184</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">called also siliqua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:10:33" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 10, 33</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:71" default="NO">11, 2, 71</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
silicula: <entryFree id="n44261" type="hapax" key="si^li^cu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĭlĭcŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>siliqua</etym>, <sense id="n44261.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little husk</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pod</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a silicle</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:23:3" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 23, 3</bibl>. <cb n="SILU" /></sense></entryFree>
siliginarius: <entryFree id="n44262" type="main" key="si^li_gi^na_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĭlīgĭnārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>siligo</etym>, <sense id="n44262.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a baker of wheat-flour</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:47:2:52:section=11" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 47, 2, 52, § 11</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 1810</bibl>; Inscr. Rein. cl. 1, n. 254; Inscr. Don. cl. 9, n. 11.</sense></entryFree>
siligineus: <entryFree id="n44263" type="main" key="si^li_gi^ne^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĭlīgĭnĕus</orth> (late form <orth extent="full" lang="la">sĭlīgnus</orth>, Dynam. 1, 7), <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n44263.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of wheat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wheaten</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">farina,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 121</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 9, 20, § 88</bibl>: panis, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 88, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 123:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 123, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Aurel. 35</bibl>: cunni, i. e. <hi rend="ital">wheaten loaves</hi> of obscene form, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:3:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 3, 3</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">Priapus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:69" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 14, 69</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">in lemm.</hi></sense></entryFree>
siligo: <entryFree id="n44264" type="main" key="si^li_go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĭlīgo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <sense id="n44264.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A kind of very white wheat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">winter-wheat</hi>: Triticum hibernum, Linn.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 35, 1</bibl>?? <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:23:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 23, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:6:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 6, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:9:5" default="NO">2, 9, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:9:13" default="NO">2, 9, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 8, 20, § 85</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:61" default="NO" valid="yes">18, 7, 10, § 61</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44264.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">fine wheaten flour</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 9, 20, § 85</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:5:70" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 5, 70</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:472" default="NO">6, 472</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
siliqua: <entryFree id="n44265" type="main" key="si^li^qua"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĭlĭqua</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <sense id="n44265.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a pod</hi> or <hi rend="ital">husk</hi> of leguminous plants, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:23:3" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 23, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 12, 30, § 120</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 74</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44265.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">sĭlĭquae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <hi rend="ital">pulse</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 123</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:3:55" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 3, 55</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:11:58" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 11, 58</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44265.2" n="II" level="1"> Siliqua Graeca, <hi rend="ital">the carob-tree</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a carob</hi>, <hi rend="ital">St. John's bread</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:10:20" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 10, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:9:6" default="NO">7, 9, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:Arb. 25:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Arb. 25, 1</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">also simply siliqua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 24, 26, § 95</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:151" default="NO" valid="yes">23, 8, 79, § 151</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Febr. 25, 27</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Insit. 117</bibl>.—A variety of the same is called siliqua Syriaca, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:151" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 8, 79, § 151</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 121" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 121</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44265.3" n="III" level="1"> The same as faenum Graecum; v. silicia.—</sense><sense id="n44265.4" n="IV" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The name of a very small weight</hi> or <hi rend="ital">measure</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Rhem. Fan.</author> Pond. 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> 1, 20, 2</bibl>.—As a coin, <hi rend="ital">the twenty-fourth part of a</hi> solidus, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 4, 32, 26 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
siliquastrum: <entryFree id="n44266" type="main" key="si^li^quastrum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĭlĭquastrum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n44266.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">also called</hi> piperitis, <hi rend="ital">pepperwort</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:187" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 12, 62, § 187</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:174" default="NO" valid="yes">20, 17, 66, § 174</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
siliquor: <entryFree id="n44267" type="main" key="si^li^quor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĭlĭquor</orth>, <itype>āri</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos> <etym>siliqua, I.</etym>, <sense id="n44267.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to put forth</hi> or <hi rend="ital">get pods</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 9, 6, § 54</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:59" default="NO" valid="yes">18, 7, 10, § 59</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
silis: <entryFree id="n44268" type="main" key="Silis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Silis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n44268.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of several rivers.</hi> </sense><sense id="n44268.1" n="1" level="3"> I. q. Jaxartes, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 16, 18, § 49</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44268.2" n="2" level="3"> I. q. Tanais, <hi rend="ital">the Don</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 7, 7, § 20</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44268.3" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A river in the Venetian territories</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 18, 22, § 126</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
silius: <entryFree id="n44269" type="main" key="Si_li^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sīlĭus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n44269.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a Roman</hi> gens. </sense><sense id="n44269.1" n="1" level="3"> P. Silius Nerva, <hi rend="ital">a proprœtor in Bithynia and Pontus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to whom are addressed the letters</hi> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 47</bibl>, and 61 sqq.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:13:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 10, 13, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44269.2" n="2" level="3"> T. Silius, <hi rend="ital">a military tribune under Cœsar</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—</sense><sense id="n44269.3" n="3" level="3"> C. Silius Italicus, <hi rend="ital">a celebrated Roman poet in the latter half of the first century of the Christian era</hi>, author of a poem still extant, called Punica, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:14:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 4, 14, 1</bibl>; v. Bähr, Röm. <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> 9, § 63 sq.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sīlĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a Silius</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Silian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">villa, negotium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 12, 27</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 31</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sillographus: <entryFree id="n44270" type="greek" key="sillo^gra^phus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sillŏgrăphus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">sillogra/fos</foreign>, <sense id="n44270.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a writer of lampoons</hi> or <hi rend="ital">satires</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 22, 16, 16</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sillybus: <entryFree id="n44271" type="main" key="silly^bus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sillybus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">si/llubon</foreign>, <sense id="n44271.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of thistle</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 22, 42, § 85</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:40" default="NO" valid="yes">26, 7, 25, § 40</bibl> (but the true reading, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 5, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 8</bibl>, a, 2, is sittybus, q. v.).</sense></entryFree>
silo: <entryFree id="n44272" type="main" key="si^lo1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĭlo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, v. 1. silus.</entryFree>
<entryFree id="n44273" type="main" key="Si^lo2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sĭlo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, v. 2. Silus.</entryFree>
silphium: <entryFree id="n44274" type="greek" key="silphi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">silphĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">si/lfion</foreign>, <sense id="n44274.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">called in pure Latin</hi> laserpitium, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 157, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 3, 15, § 38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:100" default="NO" valid="yes">22, 23, 48, § 100</bibl> (<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:17:7" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 17, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:7:4" default="NO">12, 7, 4</bibl>, written as Greek).</sense></entryFree>
silpia: <entryFree id="n44275" type="main" key="Silpia"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Silpia</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n44275.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city of</hi> Hispania Baetica, prob. <hi rend="ital">Linares</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
silures: <entryFree id="n44276" type="main" key="Silu^res"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Silŭres</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*si/lures</foreign>, <sense id="n44276.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a warlike people of Britain</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 16, 30, § 103</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 11</bibl> and 17; cf. Mannert, Britan. p. 53 sq.</sense></entryFree>
silurus: <entryFree id="n44277" type="greek" key="si^lu_rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĭlūrus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">si/louros</foreign>, <sense id="n44277.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a riverfish</hi>, prob. <hi rend="ital">the sheat-fish</hi>: Silurus glanis, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 15, 17, § 44</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:104" default="NO" valid="yes">32, 9, 33, § 104</bibl>; Lucil. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=47" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 47</bibl> Müll; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:4:33" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 4, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:132" default="NO">14, 132</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Mos. 135</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
silus: <entryFree id="n44278" type="main" key="si^lus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n44278.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">having a broad</hi>, <hi rend="ital">turned-up nose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pug-nosed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">snub-nosed</hi>, <foreign lang="greek">simo/s</foreign> (cf. simus): <cit><quote lang="la">ecquos (deos arbitramur) silos, flaccos, frontones? etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:29:80" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 29, 80</bibl></cit>; ante-class. collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">sīlo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 2, 2, 11</bibl>; Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 25, 25</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n44279" type="main" key="Si^lus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sĭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sīlo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>1. silus</etym>, <sense id="n44279.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman surname</hi>, esp. of the gens Sergia. </sense><sense id="n44279.1" n="1" level="3"> M. Sergius Orata Silus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:70:285" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 70, 285</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44279.2" n="2" level="3"> M. Sergius Silus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:27:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 32, 27, 7</bibl>; <pb n="1700" /> <cb n="SILV" /> Eckhel. D. N. 5, p. 306.—</sense><sense id="n44279.3" n="3" level="3"> Domitius Silus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 59 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl> al.—</sense><sense id="n44279.4" n="4" level="3"> In the form Silo: <cit><quote lang="la">Arruntius Silo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:19:27" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 48, 19, 27</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:158" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 59, § 158</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
silva: <entryFree id="n44280" type="main" key="silva"><orth extent="full" lang="la">silva</orth> (less correctly <orth extent="full" lang="la">sylva</orth>), <itype>ae</itype> (old <sense id="n44280.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> silvaï; <cit><quote lang="la">silua as trisyl.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:23:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 23, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:13:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epod. 13, 2</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 546</bibl> P.), <gen>f.</gen> <etym>cf. Gr. <foreign lang="greek">u(/lh</foreign></etym>,, <hi rend="ital">a wood</hi>, <hi rend="ital">forest</hi>, <hi rend="ital">woodland</hi> (syn.: saltus, nemus, lucus). </sense><sense id="n44280.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: (lupus) Conicit in silvam sese, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 378, 19</bibl> (Ann. v. 75 Vahl.): omne sonabat Arbustum fremitu silvaï frondosaï, id. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 6, 2</bibl> (Ann. v. 197 ib.): <cit><quote lang="la">(ignes) Conficerent silvas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:906" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 906</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per silvas profundas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 41</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:992" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 992</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">densa et aspera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 12, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:50:114" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 50, 114</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Ancus Marcius) silvas maritimas omnes publicavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:18:33" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 18, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rursus ex silvā in nostros impetum facerent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Caesar silvas caedere instituit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juga coepta movere Silvarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:257" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 257</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dea silvarum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Diana</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:163" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 163</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">silvarum numina, Fauni Et Satyri fratres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:6:392" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 392</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nemorosis abdita silvis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:10:687" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 687</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stabula silvis obscura vetustis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:6:521" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 521</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gloria silvarum pinus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:5:1:151" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 5, 1, 151</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">formidolosae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:5:55" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 5, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">salubres,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 4, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:34:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 34, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Silvius, casu quodam in silvis natus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 3, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44280.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n44280.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A plantation of trees</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an orchard</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a grove; a growth</hi> or <hi rend="ital">crop</hi> of other plants, <hi rend="ital">bush</hi>, <hi rend="ital">foliage</hi>, etc. (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">signa in silvā disposita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:19:section=51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 19, § 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domūs amoenitas silvā constabat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:13:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 13, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 86:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 86, 3</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">inter silvas Academi quaerere verum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tristis lupini Sustuleris fragiles calamos silvamque sonantem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 76</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 152</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 310</bibl>; 4, 273; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:346" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 346</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 80</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">12, 352</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Grat.</author> Cyneg. 47</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:9:7 al" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 9, 7 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">i. q. frondes,</quote> <trans><tr>foliage</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:242" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 242</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">congeries silvae,</quote> <trans><tr>of wood</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:9:235" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 235</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44280.4" n="2" level="3"> In <number>plur.</number>, <hi rend="ital">trees</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">nemus omne intendat vertice silvas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:14:5" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 14, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">silvarum aliae pressos propaginis arcus Exspectant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fractis obtendunt limina silvis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:2:248" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 2, 248</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:2:409" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 2, 409</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4:525" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 525</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">bracchia silvarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:362" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 362</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:4:3:79" default="NO"><author>id.</author> S. 4, 3, 79</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 3, 98</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Oedip. 542" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Oedip. 542</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44280.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a crowded mass</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abundance</hi> or <hi rend="ital">quantity</hi> (class.; <cit><quote lang="la">in Cic. sometimes with quasi): omnis ubertas et quasi silva dicendi ducta ab illis (Academicis) est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:3:12" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 3, 12</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 41, 139</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">silvae satis ad rem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:4:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 4, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">silva rerum, sententiarumque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:26:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 26, 103</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">silva virtutum et vitiorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 30, 118</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">silva observationum sermonis antiqui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:24" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Gram. 24 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: immanis, <hi rend="ital">an immense forest</hi> (of darts), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:887" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 887</bibl>; cf.: densam ferens in pectore silvam, <hi rend="ital">a forest</hi> (of darts), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:205" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 6, 205</bibl> Cort.: <cit><quote lang="la">horrida siccae Silva comae,</quote> <trans><tr>a bristling forest</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:9:13" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 9, 13</bibl></cit>: Silva, as <hi rend="ital">the title of a book;</hi> cf. Gell. Noct. Att. praef. § 6; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:3:17" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 3, 17</bibl>.—So the Silvae of Statius.</sense></entryFree>
silvanae: <entryFree id="n44281" type="gloss" key="Silva_nae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Silvānae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype> (<case>dat.</case> Silvanabus), <gen>f.</gen> <etym>silva</etym>, <sense id="n44281.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">female wood-deities</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2103</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
silvanus: <entryFree id="n44282" type="main" key="Silva_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Silvānus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Sylv-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n44282.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Silvanus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a deity presiding over woods and all places planted with trees</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the god of woods</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the rural Mars</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 83</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:10:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 10, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:600" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 8, 600</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 1, 20</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 143</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:29:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 3, 29, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:2:22" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epod. 2, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:639" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 639</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:6:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 4, 6, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 6, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:35:89" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 35, 89</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr.
