Orell.</author> 276</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">328</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">333</bibl>; 882; 1587 sq. al.—</sense><sense id="n44282.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <number>plur.</number>, <hi rend="ital">the gods of woods and fields</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sylvan deities</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sylvans</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:193" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 193</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:403" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 3, 403</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 1616</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44282.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A Roman proper name</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Caes. 42" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Caes. 42</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
silvaticus: <entryFree id="n44283" type="main" key="silva_ti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">silvātĭcus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">sylv-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n44283.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a wood</hi> or <hi rend="ital">to trees</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wood-</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">falces,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 11, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:22:5" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 22, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44283.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of plants and animals, <hi rend="ital">growing</hi> or <hi rend="ital">running wild</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wild</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">laurus, mala, pirus. etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 8, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">143, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pirus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:40:5" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 40, 5</bibl></cit>: sus, id. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 555, 31</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Aug. 8, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 30, 8, 22, § 70</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
silvesco: <entryFree id="n44284" type="main" key="silvesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">silvesco</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">sylv-</orth>), <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n44284.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> [id.], of the grape-vine, <hi rend="ital">to grow</hi> or <hi rend="ital">run wild</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to run to wood</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(vitis) ne silvescat sarmentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:15:52" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 15, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec pati vitem silvescere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:11:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 11, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44284.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">capilli silvescentium crinium velleribus involuti,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 3, p. 109</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
silvestris: <entryFree id="n44285" type="main" key="silvestris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">silvestris</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">silvester</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 16</bibl>, <cb n="SIMI" /> 19, § 110; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1</bibl>, praef. 25; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Hippol. 460" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Hippol. 460</bibl>; also written <orth extent="full" lang="la">sylv-</orth>), <itype>e</itype> (collat. form, <case>dat.</case> SILVANO SILVESTRO, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4990</bibl>; <sense id="n44285.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen. plur.</hi> sync. silvestrum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0400,001:Trag. Rel. v. 256" default="NO"><author>Att.</author> Trag. Rel. v. 256</bibl> Rib.), <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>silva</etym>. </sense><sense id="n44285.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a wood</hi> or <hi rend="ital">forest</hi>, <hi rend="ital">overgrown with woods</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wooded</hi>, <hi rend="ital">woody</hi> (class.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn. saltuosus): collis silvestris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mons,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:12:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 12, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:53:132" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 53, 132</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">locus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:19:68" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 19, 68</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 19</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 34</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:26:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 26, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">saltus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:3:21" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 3, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">antra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:52" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 2, 52</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 186</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">via (with inculta),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:74:259" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 74, 259</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">silvestris et montuosus situs (opp. campestris),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:2:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">silvestria saecla ferarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:965" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 965</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1410" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 1410</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">belua,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>a she-wolf</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:2:4" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 2, 4</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">hence also: uber,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>of a she-wolf</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:9" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 9</bibl></cit> (4, 8), 51: <cit><quote lang="la">homines,</quote> <trans><tr>living in woods</tr>, <tr>foresters</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:391" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 391</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">numen, sphinx,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 12, 17, § 77</bibl></cit> (Jahn reads de quā siluere): <cit><quote lang="la">bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1244" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1244</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">silvestri nata sub umbrā fraga,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:815" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 815</bibl></cit>: silvestria virgulta, i. e. <hi rend="ital">foresttrees</hi> (opp. prolem olivae), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 2</bibl>.— <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">silvestrĭa</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <hi rend="ital">woodlands</hi>, <hi rend="ital">forest</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">an culta ex silvestribus facere potui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:49:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 49, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 7, 33, § 70</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44285.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n44285.3" n="A" level="2"> Of plants and animals, <hi rend="ital">growing wild</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wild</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tauri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 21, 30, § 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arietes (with feri),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:2:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gallinae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:8:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 8, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arbor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:3:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 3, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arbores silvestres ac ferae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:1:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pruni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:2:20" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 2, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">faba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 12, 30, § 121</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mel,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 11, 16, 15, § 41</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Matt. 3, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cicer,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:148" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 25, 72, § 148</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oliva,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:681" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 681</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:2:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 2, 57</bibl></cit> et saep.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">silvestriora omnia tardiora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 27, 50, § 116</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:146" default="NO" valid="yes">22, 25, 71, § 146</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44285.4" n="B" level="2"> In gen., for agrestis, <hi rend="ital">sylvan</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rural</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pastoral</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">Musa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:589" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 589</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 1, 2</bibl> (for which, agrestis, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 8</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">truculentus et silvester,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Hippol. 461" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Hippol. 461</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
silvia: <entryFree id="n44286" type="main" key="Silvi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Silvĭa</orth>, v. 1, Rhea.</entryFree>
silvicola: <entryFree id="n44287" type="main" key="silvi^co^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">silvĭcŏla</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">sylv-</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>comm.</gen> <etym>silvacolo</etym>, <sense id="n44287.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inhabiting woods</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sylvan</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">silvicolae homones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0112,001:B. Pun. 2:17" default="NO"><author>Naev.</author> B. Pun. 2, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">viri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:13" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 13</bibl></cit> (4, 12), 34: <cit><quote lang="la">Faunus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:551" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 551</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pales,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:746" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 746</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
silvicultrix: <entryFree id="n44288" type="hapax" key="silvi^cultrix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">silvĭ-cultrix</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">sylv-</orth>), <itype>īcis</itype>, <sense id="n44288.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. f.</hi> [silva], <hi rend="ital">living in the woods</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cerva,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:63:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 63, 72</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
silvifragus: <entryFree id="n44289" type="hapax" key="silvi^fra^gus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">silvĭfrăgus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">sylv-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>silva-frango</etym>, <sense id="n44289.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">breaking</hi> or <hi rend="ital">crushing the forest</hi> or <hi rend="ital">trees</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">flabra venti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:275" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 275</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
silviger: <entryFree id="n44290" type="main" key="silvi^ger"><orth extent="full" lang="la">silvĭger</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">sylv-</orth>), <itype>gĕra, gĕrum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>silva-gero</etym>, <sense id="n44290.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">bearing woods</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wooded</hi>, <hi rend="ital">woody</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">montes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 3, 26, § 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">DEVS,</quote> <trans><tr>a sylvan deity</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 1488</bibl></cit> (perhaps spurious).</sense></entryFree>
silvini: <entryFree id="n44291" type="main" key="Silvi_ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Silvīni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n44291.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of Apulia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 11, 16, § 105</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
silvius: <entryFree id="n44292" type="main" key="Silvi^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Silvĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n44292.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of several kings of</hi> Alba Longa, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:769" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 769</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:610" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 610</bibl>.—Hence the <hi rend="ital">fem.</hi> Silvia; v. 1. Rhea.</sense></entryFree>
silvosus: <entryFree id="n44293" type="main" key="silvo_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">silvōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>silva</etym>, <sense id="n44293.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of woods</hi> or <hi rend="ital">trees</hi>, <hi rend="ital">woody</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">saltus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rami emicant silvosā multitudine,</quote> <trans><tr>forestlike</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 5, 11, § 23</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">crebrae arbores et silvosae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 8, 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
silvula: <entryFree id="n44294" type="main" key="silvu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">silvŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n44294.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little wood</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a copse</hi> (very rare), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:15:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 15, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Carm. 9, 229</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
silybum: <entryFree id="n44295" type="greek" key="si_ly^bum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sīlybum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = sillybus, q v.</entryFree>
sima: <entryFree id="n44296" type="main" key="si_ma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sīma</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>; <sense id="n44296.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">in architecture,</quote> <trans><tr>a moulding</tr>, <tr>the ogee</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 3, 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 207</bibl>, col. 1.</sense></entryFree>
simbruvium: <entryFree id="n44297" type="main" key="Simbru^vi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Simbrŭvĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n44297.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a district in Latium</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abounding in hills and springs of water</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:371" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 371</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Simbrŭīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Simbruvium</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">colles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stagna,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 22</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
simia: <entryFree id="n44298" type="main" key="si_mi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sīmĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (rarely <gen>m.</gen>), or <orth extent="full" lang="la">sīmĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>etym. dub.; perh. akin with similis</etym>. <sense id="n44298.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An ape</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:215" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 54, 80, § 215</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:246" default="NO" valid="yes">11, 44, 100, § 246</bibl>; Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:35:97" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 35, 97</bibl> (Sat. v. 45 Vahl.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:34:76" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 34, 76</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 32, 69</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 2, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 2, 23</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 2, 106</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:1:6 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 3, 1, 6 sq.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 4, 66</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:11:30 al" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 11, 30 al.</bibl> —Form simius, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:1:10:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 1, 10, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:1:10:8" default="NO" valid="yes">1, 10, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:202" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 202</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> in Eutr. 1, 303</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44298.1" n="II" level="1"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n44298.2" n="A" level="2"> As a term of abuse (hence even simia in the <hi rend="ital">masc.</hi>): quis hic est simia, qui, etc., Afran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 84</bibl>; so, simia, Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:12:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 12, 2</bibl>: simius, Laber. ap. Charis. l. l.; Vatin. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:10:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 10, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44298.3" n="B" level="2"> Of imitators: vide, ut fastidit simia!<cb n="SIMI" />  <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:4:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 4, 2, 4</bibl>; so, simia, Plin Ep. 1, 5, 2; Capitol. Max. jun. 1; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 1, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">simius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:10:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 10, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 4:26" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 4, 26 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
simila: <entryFree id="n44299" type="main" key="si^mi^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĭmĭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>root si, to sift; cf. Gr. <foreign lang="greek">i(malia/</foreign>; Germ. Semmel</etym>, <sense id="n44299.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the finest wheat flour</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 18 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:30" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:13:10" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 13, 10</bibl> <hi rend="ital">in lemm.;</hi> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 52, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">54, 11</bibl>.—Called also, <orth extent="full" lang="la">sĭmĭlāgo</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 10, 20, § 89</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> in Luc. 8, § 49</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,004:7:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Num. 7, 13</bibl> et saep.</sense></entryFree>
similagineus: <entryFree id="n44300" type="main" key="si^mi^la_gi^ne^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĭmĭlāgĭnĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>similago</etym>, <sense id="n44300.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">made of fine wheat flour</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">panis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Ecclus. 39, 31</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
similago: <entryFree id="n44301" type="main" key="si^mi^la_go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĭmĭlāgo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, v. simila.</entryFree>
similigenus: <entryFree id="n44302" type="hapax" key="si^mi^li^ge^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĭmĭlĭgĕnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>similisgigno</etym>, <sense id="n44302.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of a like kind</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 2:19" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 2, 19</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
similis: <entryFree id="n44303" type="main" key="si^mi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĭmĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>Sanscr. samā, together; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">a(/ma, omoi=os</foreign>; Lat. simul, simulare; cf. simia</etym>, <sense id="n44303.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">like</hi>, <hi rend="ital">resembling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">similar</hi> (cf. par); constr. with <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> (so usu. in ante-Aug. Lat.), with <case>dat.</case> (rare in Cic., except with neuter nouns), with <hi rend="ital">inter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">atque</hi>, and <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> </sense><sense id="n44303.1" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> (mostly ante - Aug.; so always in Plaut. and Ter.; cf. Brix ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:1:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 1, 2, 7</bibl>; but in Cic. almost exclusively of living beings; yet always veri simile; v. Madv. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:5:12" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 5, 12</bibl>); <cit><quote lang="la">of persons: similes avorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1218" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1218</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nimis simili'st mei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:286" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 286</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 226</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ecquid mei similist (puer)?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:6:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 2, 6, 24</bibl></cit> Speng.: <cit><quote lang="la">omnis inveniri similis tui vis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:4:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 3, 4, 50</bibl></cit> Brix: <cit><quote lang="la">ita est istaec (amica) hujus similis nostrae tua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:6:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 2, 6, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alia ejus similis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 5, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">similis est Sagaristionis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:1:1:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 1, 1, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hominis similis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:28:78" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 28, 78</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:9:14:2" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 9, 14, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">symbolum ejus similem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:1:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 1, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sui similem speciem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:15:34" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 15, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sui similis res,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:830" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 830</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">volo me patris mei similem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:1:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 1, 1, 53</bibl></cit>: patris similem esse. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:12:section=30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 12, § 30</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">non tam potuit patris similis esse, quam ille fuerat sui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:33:121" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 33, 121</bibl></cit>: quaererem ex eo, cujus suorum similis fuisset Africani fratris nepos; facie vel patris, vitā omnium perditorum ita similis, ut esset facile deterrimus; <cit><quote lang="la">cujus etiam similis P. Crassi nepos, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:33:81" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 33, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tui similis est probe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:5:3:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 5, 3, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">est similis majorum suorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:3:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. 3, 3, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haud similis virgo est virginum nostrarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:3:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 2, 3, 22</bibl></cit>: haud parasitorum aliorum simil'est, Naev. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 224, 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">virum non similem furis hujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:3:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 3, 3, 91</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domini similis es,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:2:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 2, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in magistratu privatorum similes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:43:67" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 43, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multi Gnathonum similes cum sint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:25:94" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 25, 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plures Romuli quam Numae similes reges,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut sis tu similis Coeli Byrrhique latronum, Non ego sim Capri neque Sulci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:4:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 4, 69</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">deos esse tui similes putas?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:128" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 128</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">tui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:6:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 2, 6, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 39</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nostri similes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 26, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sui similis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 2, 7</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">alterum similem sui quaerere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:22:82" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 22, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil est appetentius similium sui quam natura,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam uterque est similis sui!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:3:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 3, 2, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tui similem esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:14:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 14, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sui similis gens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 4</bibl></cit>.—Of things: <cit><quote lang="la">tam similem quam lacte lactist (i. e. lactis est, Brix ad loc.),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:2:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 2, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec atque hujus similia alia damna,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 1, 105</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perpulchra credo dona aut nostri similia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 2, 15</bibl></cit> Umpfenb.: <cit><quote lang="la">quid habet illius carminis simile haec oratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:36:56" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 36, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si fabularum similia didicimus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paupertatem, ignominiam, similia horum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:15:51" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 3, 15, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">similes meorum versus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nonne hoc monstri simile'st?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:3:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 3, 43</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">monstri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 5, 7</bibl></cit> (8), 61: <cit><quote lang="la">prodigii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,033:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Lig. 4, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">narrationem veri similem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:19:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 19, 83</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">Cels. ap. Cuint. 2, 15, 32: simile veri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 12, 5, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae similia veri sint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 21</bibl></cit> Drak. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.;</hi> v. verus, and cf. also in the foll.—In comparing persons with things: <cit><quote lang="la">hominem quojus rei Similem esse arbitrarer simulacrumque habere ... Novarum aedium esse arbitror similem ego hominem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:2:6 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 2, 6 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amator simil'est oppidi hostilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:1:2:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 1, 2, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">meretricem esse similem sentis condecet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 1, 16</bibl></cit>: tu pueri pausilli simili'es, Nov. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 224, 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">equi te Esse feri similem dico,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:5:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 5, 57</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: hominem hominis similiorem numquam vid: ego alterum, Neque aqua aquae, neque lac <pb n="1701" /> <cb n="SIMI" /> test lactis usquam similius, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:9:29 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 9, 29 sq.</bibl> Brix ad loc.: <cit><quote lang="la">Rhodii Atticorum similiores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:13:52" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 13, 52</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic noster quaestus aucupii simillimu'st,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:3:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 1, 3, 63</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:8:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 4, 8, 72</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">meretrix fortunati oppidi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:1:1:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cist. 1, 1, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tener et lactens puerique simillimus aevo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:201" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 201</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">simillima societas hereditatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:18:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Com. 18, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid esset simillimum veri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:4:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 4, 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44303.2" n="(b)" level="5"> With <case>dat.</case> (of both persons and things; freq., and in post-Aug. writers almost always; not in Plaut. or Ter. acc. to Ritschl, Opusc. 2, 570 sq.; 579 sq.; but contra, v. Ussing ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:v. 595" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. v. 595</bibl>): simia quam similis nobis, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:35:97" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 35, 97</bibl> (Sat. v. 45 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">patri suo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:61:221" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 61, 221</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">similis quidem (genitos) alios avo et ex geminis quoque alterum patri, alterum matri, annoque post genitum majori similem fuisse ut geminum. Quasdam sibi similis semper parere, quasdam viro, quasdam nulli, quasdam feminam patri, marem sibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 12, 10, § 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">similis malo est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:2:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 3, 2, 36</bibl></cit>: Terentio non similem dices quempiam, Afran. ap. Suet. Vit. Ter. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">filius patri similis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:5:12" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 5, 12</bibl></cit> Madv. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sit suo similis patri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:61:217" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 61, 217</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:622" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 622</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parentibus ac majoribus suis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:24" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">par similisque ceteris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 14:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 14, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">huic in hoc similis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 37, 118</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">similes Icilio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hinnuleo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:23:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 23, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">puro te similem vespero petit Rhode,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 19, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multum similis metuenti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:5:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 5, 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fluctuanti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 13</bibl></cit> Drak.: <cit><quote lang="la">flenti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:652" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 652</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cognoscenti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:2:501" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 501</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">roganti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:3:240" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 240</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cogitantibus et dubitantibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:2:47" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 2, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ediscenti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:2:46" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 2, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legenti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:2:32" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 2, 32</bibl></cit> et saep.—Of things: <cit><quote lang="la">res similis nostris rebus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:435" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 435</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid simile habet epistula aut judicio aut contioni?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:21:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 21, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid illi simile bello fuit?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui non Fescennino versu (i. e. versui) similem jaciebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 2</bibl></cit> Drak. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">argumentum vero simile comoediae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:4:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 4, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">similia veris erant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:20:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 20, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">partim vera partim mixta eoque similia veris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:20:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 29, 20, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:20:5" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 20, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cui vitio simile sit schema, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:10" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 3, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">primus (iambus) ad extremum similis sibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:254" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 254</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">versus sibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:60" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oratio fuit precibus quam jurgio similis, similior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 40</bibl></cit> Drak. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.—Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">flunt omnia castris quam urbi similiora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 31 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">similius vero facit ipsos in amicitiam redisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:26:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 26, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:26:13" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 26, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:8:31" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 8, 31</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">puro simillimus amni,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 120</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">media simillima veris sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">simillimum id vero fecit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:30:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 44, 30, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44303.3" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> and <case>dat.</case> together: <cit><quote lang="la">tum similes matrum materno semine fiunt, Ut patribus patrio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1211" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1211</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque lac lacti magis est simile quam ille ego similis est mei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:1:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 1, 54</bibl></cit> Ussing ad loc.: <cit><quote lang="la">deos hominum quam homines deorum, hoc illi, illud huic,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:32:90" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 32, 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">itaque plectri similem linguam nostri solent dicere, chordarum dentis, naris cornibus iis, qui, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 59, 149</bibl></cit>; cf. under <foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>.—</sense><sense id="n44303.4" n="(d)" level="5"> In a doubtful construction. On account of the form: <cit><quote lang="la">fugae similis profectio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 47</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">6, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 43</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 13</bibl> et saep.—Because of an unsettled reading: <cit><quote lang="la">similem Caesaris (or Caesari),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:52" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 52</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in speciem Junonis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 10, p. 253 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—（<foreign lang="greek">z</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">inter</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">homines inter se cum formā tum moribus similes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:16:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 16, 46</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">homines inter se (opp. differentes),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:22" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(catulos) Inter se similes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:835" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 835</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae sunt inter se similia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:54:206" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 54, 206</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res inter se similes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:51" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 2, 51</bibl></cit>.—In a twofold construction: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil est unum uni tam simile, tam par, quam omnes inter nosmetipsos sumus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:10:29" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 10, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sunt inter se similia, sed non etiam prioribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:49" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 3, 49</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">h</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">atque</hi> (<hi rend="ital">ac</hi>), <hi rend="ital">et</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ut si</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tamquam si</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quid docere vis, aliquid ab isto simile in aestimatione atque a ceteris esse factum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:83:section=193" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 83, § 193</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut simili ratione atque ipse fecerit suas injurias persequantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 38 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec similem habeat vultum, et si ampullam perdidisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:12:31" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 4, 12, 31</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">v. Madv. ad h. l.: similes sunt, ut si qui dicant, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:6:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 6, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">similes sunt di, tamquam si Poeni, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:64:131" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 64, 131</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">q</foreign>) <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">decet facta moresque hujus habere me similes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Plaut.</author> Am 1</bibl></cit>, <cb n="SIMI" /> 1, 114: <cit><quote lang="la">ex uno puteo similior numquam potis Aqua aeque sumi, quam haec est atque ista,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:6:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 2, 6, 68</bibl></cit> Brix ad loc.: <cit><quote lang="la">ita formā simili pueri (gemini), ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:prol. 19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. prol. 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">meus est (puer), nimium quidem simili'st,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:6:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 2, 6, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laudantur simili prole puerperae,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>that look like their fathers</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:5:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 5, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ecce similia omnia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:2:1:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 2, 1, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">par est avaritia, similis improbitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:40:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 40, 118</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">but cf., in a more restricted sense: similia omnia magis quam paria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad quam (amicitiam) se similis animus applicet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:14:48" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 14, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sicut erat in simili causā antea factum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:37:63" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 37, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod in simili culpā versabantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 110</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">simili ratione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 7, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:76 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 76 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">similem esse te volo quomodo filium, non quomodo imaginem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 84:8" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 84, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ecce aliud simile, dissimile,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:27:76" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 4, 27, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quis Aristotelem similem emit,</quote> <trans><tr>a likeness of Aristotle</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:2:6" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 2, 6</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">tabella, in quā tam similem videbis Issam, ut sit tam similis sibi nec ipsa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:109:19 sq" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 109, 19 sq.</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:87:4" default="NO">7, 87, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">te similem,</quote> <trans><tr>your likeness</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:3:3:201" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 3, 3, 201</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 1, 1</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, adverb. (=similiter): <cit><quote lang="la">similis medios Juturna per hostīs Fertur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:477" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 477</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">similiorem mulierem Magisque eandem non reor deos facere posse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:6:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 6, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil hoc simile est similius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:290" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 1, 1, 290</bibl></cit>. —<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">simillimos dicito esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:2:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 2, 91</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">sĭmĭle</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> </sense><sense id="n44303.5" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A comparison</hi>, <hi rend="ital">likeness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">parallel case</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">example</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo facilius res perspici possit hoc simile ponitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:16:54" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 3, 16, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">utuntur simili,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 14, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec improbum sit pro simili accipi, quod plus sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:1:61" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 1, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui memoriam ab aliquo simili transferunt ad id, quod, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:2:30" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 2, 30</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">ignavi et erepti et similia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:69" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 5, 69</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:6:2" default="NO">1, 6, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:4:26" default="NO">2, 4, 26</bibl>; 3, 5, 16 et saep.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">latitatio, metus, similia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:2:46" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 2, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de philosophiā, de republicā, similibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 4, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:153" default="NO">11, 3, 153</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44303.6" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Resemblance</hi>, simile et majus est et par et minus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:8:7" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 8, 7</bibl>.— <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi> in two forms, simulter (ante-class.) and similiter (class.). * </sense><sense id="n44303.7" n="a" level="4"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">sĭmulter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">in like manner</hi>, <hi rend="ital">similarly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">exossabo ego illum simulter itidem ut muraenam coquos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:3:148" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 3, 148</bibl></cit> (cited ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 170, 25</bibl>: simulter pro similiter); v. Ritschl ad <bibl default="NO"><author>Plaut.</author> 1</bibl>. 1.—</sense><sense id="n44303.8" n="b" level="4"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">sĭmĭlĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">in like manner</hi>, <hi rend="ital">similarly</hi> (syn. pariter). </sense><sense id="n44303.9" n="(a)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg> (so most freq.): <cit><quote lang="la">ecquid adsimulo similiter?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:1:2:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 1, 2, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">similiter atque uno modo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:66:233" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 66, 233</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illa quae similiter desinunt aut quae cadunt similiter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:54:206" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 54, 206</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:11:25" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 4, 11, 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si non similiter semper ingrediamur in argumentationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:41:76" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 1, 41, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">addunt etiam C. Marium ... Similiter vos, cum, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 5, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quorum non similiter fides est nec justitia laudata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:36:61" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 36, 61</bibl></cit> et saep.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: scurram multo similius imitatum, <hi rend="ital">more perfectly</hi> or <hi rend="ital">naturally</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:5:5:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 5, 5, 34</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut, etc. ... simillime, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>just so</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:23:54" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 23, 54</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44303.10" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">atque</hi> (<hi rend="ital">ac</hi>), <hi rend="ital">et</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ut si</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque vero illum similiter, atque ipse eram, commotum esse vidi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:1:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 1, 4, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 23, 72</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:7:26" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 7, 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">similiter facis, ac si me roges, cur, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:3:8" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">similiter facere eos ... ut si nautae certarent, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:25:87" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 25, 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">similiter facit ut si posse putet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:18:41" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 4, 18, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">similiter et si dicat, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:7:21" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 7, 21</bibl></cit>; v. Madv. ad h. l.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic excipit Pompeium, simillime atque ut illā lege Glaucippus excipitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:1:4:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 1, 4, 13</bibl></cit>.— * </sense><sense id="n44303.11" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">similiter his, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 25, 30, § 86</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
similitas: <entryFree id="n44304" type="main" key="si^mi^li^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĭmĭlĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>similis</etym> a rare form for similitudo, <sense id="n44304.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">likeness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">resemblance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">similarity</hi>: morum, Caecil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 177, 2</bibl> (Com. Rel. v. 216 Rib.).—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">naturae rerum similitates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 2, 9 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
similiter: <entryFree id="n44305" type="main" key="si^mi^li^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĭmĭlĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. similis <sense id="n44305.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
similitudo: <entryFree id="n44306" type="main" key="si^mi^li^tu_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĭmĭlĭtūdo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>similis</etym>. <sense id="n44306.0" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">likeness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">resemblance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">similitude</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n44306.1" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">id ex similitudine floris lilium appellabant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">id ad similitudinem panis efficiebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 48</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">umor ex hordeo aut frumento in quandam similitudinem vini corruptus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">armorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">coronae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:11:28" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 11, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">similitudo speciesque sapientium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:4:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 4, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">studiorum societas similitudoque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:7:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 7, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: artis imago et similitudo. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:87:356" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 87, 356</bibl>: similitudo<cb n="SIMO" />  servitutis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:27:43" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 27, 43</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">domini,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 34, 46</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 28, 44</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">regum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 41, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quorum (virorum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:46:110" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 46, 110</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amoris humani,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:21:81" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 21, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (gloria) habet speciem honestatis et similitudinem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:24:69" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 24, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si cupis in te conparebit similitudo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 84:8" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 84, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exemplum deorum hominisve similitudinis expressae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 7, 17, § 38</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44306.2" n="(b)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec vero ille artifex (Phidias), cum faceret Jovis formam aut Minervae, contemplabatur aliquem, e quo similitudinem duceret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:2:9" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 2, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam intuens ad illius similitudinem artem et manum dirigebat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>; so of <hi rend="ital">a likeness</hi> in a portrait or image: <cit><quote lang="la">nemo, quamvis paratos habeat colores, similitudinem reddet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 71:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 71, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 7, 17, § 38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:88" default="NO" valid="yes">35, 10, 36, § 88</bibl>; and in the <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:151" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 35, 12, 43, § 151</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil est, quod ad se rem ullam tam alliciat, quam ad amicitiam similitudo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:14:50" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 14, 50</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:23:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 23, 96</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">so of mind or character: est igitur homini cum deo similitudo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:8:25" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 8, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">est nonnulla in his etiam inter ipsos similitudo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:16:63" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 16, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad similitudinem deo propius accedebat humana virtus quam, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>comes nearer in likeness</tr>, <tr>bears a nearer resemblance</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:34:96" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 34, 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hanc similitudinem qui imitatione adsequi volet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:23:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 23, 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">genus imperii proximum similitudini regiae,</quote> <trans><tr>bearing a very close resemblance to the royal power</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:32:56" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 32, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contrahit celeriter similitudo eos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:46:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 46, 7</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut omittam similitudines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:40:62" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 40, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sunt quaedam animi similitudines cum corpore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:23:54" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 2, 23, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per rationem similitudines conparare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:4:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 4, 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44306.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n44306.4" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Imitation</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">esse multos qui neminem imitentur, et suāpte naturā, quod velint, sine cujusquam similitudine consequantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:23:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 23, 98</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44306.5" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Analogy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">application to similar cases</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">deduxisti totam hanc rem in duo genera solum causarum, cetera innumerabilia exercitationi et similitudini reliquisti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:17:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 17, 71</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44306.6" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Sameness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">uniformity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">monotony</hi>: variare autem orationem magno opere oportebit; <cit><quote lang="la">nam omnibus in rebus similitudo est satietatis mater,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:41:76" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 41, 76</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44306.7" n="D" level="2"> In partic., rhetor. t. t., <hi rend="ital">a comparison</hi>, <hi rend="ital">simile</hi>, <hi rend="ital">similitude</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">similitudo est oratio traducens ad rem quampiam aliquid ex re dispari simile,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 45, 59</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:40:168" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 40, 168</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:10:41" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Top. 10, 41</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">argumentorum et similitudinum copia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:38:143" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 38, 143 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:1:31" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 1, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:2" default="NO">9, 2, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:72" default="NO">8, 3, 72</bibl> et saep.</sense></entryFree>
similo: <entryFree id="n44307" type="main" key="si^mi^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĭmĭlo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, v. simulo.</entryFree>
simininus: <entryFree id="n44308" type="main" key="si_mi^ni_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sīmĭnīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>simia</etym>, <sense id="n44308.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to apes</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">herba,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 86</bibl></cit>: caput, Jul. Obs. Prod. 103.</sense></entryFree>
simiolus: <entryFree id="n44309" type="hapax" key="si_mi^o^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sīmĭŏlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>simius</etym>, <sense id="n44309.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little ape</hi>, as a term of abuse, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 2, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
simitu: <entryFree id="n44310" type="main" key="si^mi_tu"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĭmītu</orth> (collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">sĭmītur</orth>, Inscr. Orell 2863; Inscr. Neap. ap. Momms. 423; v. Corss. Krit. Beitr. p. 400), <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>Sanscr. sama; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">o(mo-</foreign>; old Lat. semo, together; cf.: semul, semper, similis, etc.</etym> (ante-class. form of simul), <sense id="n44310.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">at once</hi>, <hi rend="ital">at the same time</hi>, <hi rend="ital">together</hi>: gratia habetur utrisque illisque sibique simitu, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 175, 16</bibl>: ita opertis oculis simitu manducatur ac molit, Pompon. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 477, 4</bibl> (Com. Rel. v. 100 Rib.): <cit><quote lang="la">multas res simitu in meo corde vorso,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 1, 1</bibl></cit> Brix ad loc.: <cit><quote lang="la">ego hic esse et illi simitu hau potero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:2:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 3, 2, 105</bibl></cit> Lorenz ad loc.: <cit><quote lang="la">ego te simitu novi cum Porthaone,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:1:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 5, 1, 45</bibl></cit>; so with <hi rend="ital">cum</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non ego cum vino simitu ebibi inperium tuom,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:1:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 2, 1, 84</bibl></cit> (where Ritschl would restore the form simitur to avoid the hiatus, so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:2:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 3, 2, 105</bibl> supra; <cit><quote lang="la">v. Ind. Schol. Bonn, 1853, p. xii.): ut cum eo simitu mitterer,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:1:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 1, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum eo simitu mitti,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 2, 55</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:1:3:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 1, 3, 94</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 2, 66</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 5, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:1:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 1, 2, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 2, 6</bibl>; Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 280, 4</bibl> (Trag. Rel. v. 79 Rib.).</sense></entryFree>
simius: <entryFree id="n44311" type="main" key="si_mi^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sīmĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, v. simia.</entryFree>
simo: <entryFree id="n44312" type="main" key="si_mo1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sīmo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>simus</etym>, <sense id="n44312.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to press flat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to flatten</hi> (only in the foll. passages): simavit taxim ad nares, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 169, 31</bibl>: simataeque jacent pando sinuamine nares, Sulp. Luperc. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Anthol. Lat.</author> 1, p. 516</bibl> Burm.: <cit><quote lang="la">projecturas simaverunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:4:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 4, 2, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n44313" type="main" key="Si^mo2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sĭmo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n44313.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a proper name</hi>, Plaut. Most.; id. Ps.; Ter. And.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:238" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 238</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:158" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 59, § 158</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 8, 7, § 23</bibl>. <pb n="1702" /> <cb n="SIMP" /></sense></entryFree>
<entryFree id="n44314" type="main" key="Si^mo3" n="3"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sĭmo</orth>, v. 1. Simon.</entryFree>
simodo: <entryFree id="n44315" type="main" key="si_mo^do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sī-mŏdo</orth>, v. modo, B. b.; and si, I. <foreign lang="greek">a</foreign>.</entryFree>
simois: <entryFree id="n44316" type="main" key="Si^mo^i_s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sĭmŏīs</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*simo/eis</foreign>, <sense id="n44316.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small river in Troas that falls into the Scamander</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Mendere Tchai</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:18:3" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 18, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 30, 33, § 124</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 100</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 618</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 88</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:13:14" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 13, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:324" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 324</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:9:12" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 9, 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
simon: <entryFree id="n44317" type="main" key="Si^mon1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sĭmon</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sĭmo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*sumew/n</foreign> (Heb. <foreign />). <sense id="n44317.0" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A chief of the Jews</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:5:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 5, 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 12</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44317.1" n="2" level="3"> Simon Petrus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:5:8 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Matt. 5, 8 al.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Juvenc.</author> 4, 584</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Sĭmŏnem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 423</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44317.2" n="3" level="3"> Simon Magus, or <hi rend="ital">the sorcerer</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:8:18 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Act. 8, 18 sq.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n44317.3" n="4" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">An Athenian writer on horsemanship</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 8, 19, § 76</bibl> (Jan. Semonem).—</sense><sense id="n44317.4" n="5" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A sculptor</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 8, 19, § 90</bibl> (scanned Sīmōn, <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Sym. 742</bibl>).</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n44318" type="main" key="Si^mon2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sĭmon</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*si/mwn</foreign>, <sense id="n44318.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a famous statuary</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 8, 19, § 90</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
simonides: <entryFree id="n44319" type="main" key="Si^mo_ni^des"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sĭmōnĭdes</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*simwni/dhs</foreign>, <sense id="n44319.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a celebrated lyric poet of Cos</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:10:20" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 10, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:42:101" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 42, 101</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 24, 59</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:22:60" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 22, 60</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:27:56" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 27, 56</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:64" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 64</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:2:11 al" default="NO">11, 2, 11 al.</bibl>—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sĭmōnĭdēus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to simonides</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacrimae,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>poems of Simonides that moved the reader to tears</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:38:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 38, 8</bibl></cit> (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:1:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 1, 38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:64" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 64</bibl>).</sense></entryFree>
simpla: <entryFree id="n44320" type="main" key="simpla"><orth extent="full" lang="la">simpla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. simplus, II. B.</entryFree>
simplaris: <entryFree id="n44321" type="main" key="simpla_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">simplāris</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>simplus</etym>; milit. t. t., <sense id="n44321.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that receives a single ration</hi> (cf. duplaris): <cit><quote lang="la">armaturae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Mil. 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">candidati,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
simplarius: <entryFree id="n44322" type="hapax" key="simpla_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">simplārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n44322.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">simple</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">venditiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:21:1:48:section=8" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 21, 1, 48, § 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
simplex: <entryFree id="n44323" type="main" key="simplex"><orth extent="full" lang="la">simplex</orth>, <itype>ĭcis</itype> (<case>abl.</case>, regul. simplici; <sense id="n44323.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">simplice,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:1013" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 1013</bibl></cit>), <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>sim-; cf. Sanscr. sam, Gr. <foreign lang="greek">a(/ma</foreign>, with Lat. sin-guli, semel, sem-per; and plico</etym>. </sense><sense id="n44323.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">simple</hi>, <hi rend="ital">plain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">uncompounded</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unmixed</hi>, = <foreign lang="greek">a(plou=s</foreign> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sincerus, purus): aut simplex est natura animantis, ut vel terrena sit, vel ignea, etc. ... aut concreta est ex pluribus naturis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:14:34" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 14, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">natura (opp. mixta, conexa, etc.),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:231" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 231</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:11:29" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 11, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:21:78" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 21, 78</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si unum ac simplex (genus inperii) probandum sit, regium probem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:35:54" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 35, 54</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 23, 43</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">finis bonorum, qui simplex esse debet, ex dissimillimis rebus misceri et temperari potest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:33:119" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 33, 119</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(comoedia) Duplex quae ex argumento facta'st simplici,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:prol. 6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. prol. 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(auditus) iter simplex et directum (opp. flexuosum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:57:144" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N.
