so, <cit><quote lang="la">Amineum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:47:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 47, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crocus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 6, 17, § 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">axungia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 9, 37, § 135</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gemma (opp. sordium plena),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 37, 8, 33, § 110</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">propria et sincera et tantum sui similis gens,</quote> <trans><tr>unmixed</tr>, <tr>pure</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 4</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">populus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 4, 64 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:40" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 40</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nobilitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 4, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nitor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 66:46" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 66, 46</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: lux sincerior, App. de Mundo, p. 58, 29.—* </sense><sense id="n44362.2" n="b" level="4"> Sincerum, adverb.: <cit><quote lang="la">non sincerum sonĕre,</quote> <trans><tr>that it does not ring clearly</tr>, <tr>is not genuine</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:873" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 873</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44362.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">Atheniensium semper fuit prudens sincerumque judicium,</quote> <trans><tr>sound</tr>, <tr>uncorrupted</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:8:25" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 8, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil erat in ejus (Cottae) oratione nisi sincerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:55:202" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 55, 202</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">esse videtur Homeri (versus) simplicior et sincerior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:26:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 26, 3</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">sincera gratia sermonis Attici,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:65" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sincera et integra natura,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 28 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Cons. Helv. 11:6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Cons. Helv. 11, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vir,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 73:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 73, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opiniones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:ib. 94:68" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 94, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Minerva,</quote> <trans><tr>pure</tr>, <tr>chaste</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:664" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 664</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sincerum equestre proelium,</quote> <trans><tr>unmixed</tr>, <tr>pure</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non sincerum gaudium praebere,</quote> <trans><tr>not unmixed</tr>, <tr>not undisturbed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 34, 41</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">gaudium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 44, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gaudium sincerius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:10:1:3" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 10, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">voluptas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:453" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 453</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fama,</quote> <trans><tr>unblemished</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:6:8:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 6, 8, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Thucydides rerum gestarum pronunciator sincerus,</quote> <trans><tr>honest</tr>, <tr>candid</tr>, <tr>upright</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:83:287" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 83, 287</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Fabii Annales, bonae atque sincerae vetustatis libri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:4:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 5, 4, 1</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Q. Claudius optimus et sincerissimus scriptor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:15:1:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 15, 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verus atque sincerus Stoicus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:2:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 2, 7</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">mirabilia multa, nihil simplex, nihil sincerum,</quote> <trans><tr>natural</tr>, <tr>genuine</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 10, 6, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil est jam sanctum neque sincerum in civitate,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid non sinceri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:57:118" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 57, 118</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fides,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">concordia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caritas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 42</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">advv.</hi> </sense><sense id="n44362.4" n="a" level="4"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">sincērē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">uprightly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">honestly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">well</hi>, <hi rend="ital">frankly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sincerely</hi>: sincere dicere, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:1:2:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 1, 2, 97</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">satin' ego oculis utilitatem obtineo sincere, an parum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:5:1:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 5, 1, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sincere et ex animo dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:109:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 109, 4</bibl></cit>: pronunciare, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 20</bibl>: agere, Attic. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:10:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 10, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">administrare provincias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:2:2:8" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 2, 2, 8</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 6</bibl> (7), 3, 55.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. ad Volus. 3" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ep. ad Volus. 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>— * </sense><sense id="n44362.5" n="b" level="4"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">sincērĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">sincerely</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid cupere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:16:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 16, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 8, 28, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sincinium: <entryFree id="n44363" type="main" key="sinci^ni^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sincĭnĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>sin- = sim- (cf. simplex) and cano</etym>, <sense id="n44363.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the song of a single person</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a solo</hi>, = <foreign lang="greek">monw|di/a</foreign> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 6, 19, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sincipitamentum: <entryFree id="n44364" type="main" key="sinci^pi^ta_mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sincĭpĭtāmentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>sinciput</etym>, = <foreign lang="greek">h(mikefa/laion</foreign>, <sense id="n44364.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a half - head</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sincipitamenta porcina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:1:3:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 1, 3, 28</bibl></cit> Ritschl, Brix.</sense></entryFree>
sinciput: <entryFree id="n44365" type="main" key="sinci^put"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sincĭput</orth>, <itype>pĭtis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>semi - caput; cf.: sinciput <foreign lang="greek">h(mikefa/lion, h(mi/kranon, h(mike/falon</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.</etym>. <sense id="n44365.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Half a head;</hi> of the smoked <hi rend="ital">cheek</hi>, <hi rend="ital">jowl</hi> of a hog, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:1:3:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 1, 3, 28</bibl> (Ritschl, sincipitamenta); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:209" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 51, 77, § 209</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:6:70" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 6, 70</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:13:85" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 13, 85</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44365.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n44365.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The brain</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non tibi Sanum est, adulescens, sinciput,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:3:2:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 3, 2, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 2, 69</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n44365.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The head</hi>, in gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">miserabile sinciput,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Carm. 5, 419</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sindenses: <entryFree id="n44366" type="main" key="Sindenses"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sindenses</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n44366.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Sinda</hi> (<foreign lang="greek">*sinda</foreign>), <hi rend="ital">a town of Pisidia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">near Cibyra and the river Caularis</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sindes: <entryFree id="n44367" type="main" key="Sindes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sindes</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <sense id="n44367.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">m.; acc.</hi> sinden, <hi rend="ital">a river in Asia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 10</bibl> Ritter (al. Gyndes).</sense></entryFree>
sindica: <entryFree id="n44368" type="main" key="Sindica"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sindica</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n44368.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a part of Scythia on the Black Sea</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 12, 26, § 84</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sindon: <entryFree id="n44369" type="greek" key="sindon"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sindon</orth>, <itype>ŏnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">sindw/n</foreign>, <sense id="n44369.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of fine cotton stuff</hi>, <hi rend="ital">muslin</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:19:12" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 4, 19, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:1:2" default="NO">11, 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ephem. in Parecb. 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:27:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Matt. 27, 59</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,002:14:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Marc. 14, 52</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,003:23:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Luc. 23, 53</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sindos: <entryFree id="n44370" type="main" key="Sindo^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sindŏs</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n44370.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city of Scythia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the Cimmerian Bosporus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:19" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 19</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sindŏnes</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Sindos</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:19" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 19</bibl>; cf. Sindica.</sense></entryFree>
sindus: <entryFree id="n44371" type="main" key="Sindus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sindus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n44371.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an Indian name of the river Indus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 20, 23, § 71</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sine: <entryFree id="n44372" type="main" key="si^ne"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĭne</orth> (old form <orth extent="full" lang="la">sē</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">sēd</orth>; <sense id="n44372.0" n="I" level="1"><xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">the foll.</ref></xr>), <pos>prep.</pos> with <case>abl.</case> [si and ne; si, the demonstrative instrumental, and the negative ne; <cit><quote lang="la">hence, nesi was also found,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=165" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 165</bibl></cit>; cf. Rib. Beiträge, p. 15; Corss. Ausspr. 1, 201; <cb n="SING" /> 1, 778]. </sense><sense id="n44372.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Without.</hi> </sense><sense id="n44372.2" n="A" level="2"> Form se (sed): <cit><quote lang="la">socordia compositum videtur ex se, quod est sine, et corde, Fest. pp. 292 and 293 Müll.: sed pro sine inveniuntur posuisse antiqui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=336" default="NO"><author>id.</author> p. 336</bibl></cit> ib.: SI PLVS MINVSVE SECVERVNT SE FRAVDE ESTO, Fragm. XII. Tab. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:20:1:49" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 20, 1, 49</bibl>: IM CVM ILLO SEPELIREI VRIVE SE FRAVDE ESTO, id. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:24:60" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 24, 60</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">EAM PECVNIAM EIS SED FRAVDE SVA SOLVITO,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 509, 20</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44372.3" n="B" level="2"> Form sine: <cit><quote lang="la">tu sine pennis vola,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:1:180" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 1, 1, 180</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne quoquam pedem Efferat sine custode,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:3:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 2, 3, 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut (urbs) sine regibus sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:37:58" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 37, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sine ullo domino,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 43, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sine ullo certo exemplari formāque rei publicae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 11, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sine ullius populi exemplo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 39, 66</bibl></cit>: sine ullā dubitatione; v. dubitatio; <cit><quote lang="la">for which, less freq.: sine omni, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:2:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 2, 2, 38</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 1, 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sine omni malitiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:5:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 5, 2, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:2:3:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 2, 3, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 1, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:8:33" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 4, 8, 33</bibl>: sine dubio; <cit><quote lang="la">v. dubius: pol si istuc faxis, haud sine poenā feceris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:5:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 5, 37</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">non sine magnā spe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non sine conscio Surgit marito,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:6:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 6, 29</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">non sine floribus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 13, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non sine multis lacrimis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 7, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non sine fistulā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 1, 24</bibl></cit>.—In poets often with a noun instead of an adjective or adverb; as, sine sanguine, <hi rend="ital">bloodless;</hi> sine pondere, <hi rend="ital">weightless;</hi> sine fine, <hi rend="ital">endless;</hi> sine nomine, <hi rend="ital">nameless;</hi> sine sidere, <hi rend="ital">starless;</hi> sine viribus, <hi rend="ital">powerless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">feeble</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">ignea vis et sine pondere caeli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 26</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:2:537" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 537</bibl>; 3, 417; 5, 249; 7, 306; 7, 275; 7, 830; 8, 518; 11, 429; 15, 120; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:204" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 204</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 694</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 534</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:14:32 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 14, 32 al.</bibl>—Hence, <usg type="style">poet.</usg>, sine pondere, like a noun in <case>dat.</case>, for rebus sine pondere: <cit><quote lang="la">pugnabant mollia cum duris, sine pondere habentia pondus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 20</bibl></cit>.—Several times repeated: <cit><quote lang="la">si sine vi et sine bello velint rapta tradere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 51</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sine praesidio et sine pecuniā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 8, 3, 5</bibl></cit>; and more freq. without <hi rend="ital">et</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">eam confeci sine molestiā, Sine sumptu, sine dispendio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 4, 6</bibl></cit> and 7: <cit><quote lang="la">hominem sine re, sine fide, sine spe, sine sede, sine fortunis, ore, linguā, manu, vita omni inquinatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:32:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 32, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se solos sine vulnere, sine ferro, sine acie victos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 5</bibl></cit>; v. Drak. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 2, 4</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">part.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">sine causā antecedente,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:19:43" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fat. 19, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sine externā et antecedente causā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sine viso antecedente,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 19, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sine inpensā operā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 4, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:12:11" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 12, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:25:7" default="NO" valid="yes">45, 25, 7</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sine rest tutā potestate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:52:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 52, 2</bibl></cit> MSS. et Madv. (Weissenb. ex conj.: quā sibi non restitutā).—In epistolary style once <hi rend="ital">without a case</hi>, referring to a preceding noun: <cit><quote lang="la">age jam, cum fratre an sine?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 8, 3, 5</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">gerund</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">nec sine canendo tibicines dicti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=75" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 75</bibl></cit> Müll.—Taking the place of a clause: <cit><quote lang="la">armantur senes aut pueri, et numerus militum sine exercitūs robore expletur,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>without acquiring</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:5:6:3" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 5, 6, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exercitus ejus sine noxā discurrit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:12:7:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 7, 8</bibl></cit>.—By the poets sometimes put after its case: <cit><quote lang="la">flammā sine thura liquescere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:5:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 5, 99</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitiis nemo sine nascitur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 3, 68</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44372.4" n="II" level="1"> In composition, se, or before a vowel, sed, denotes <hi rend="ital">a going</hi> or <hi rend="ital">taking aside</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a departing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">separating</hi>, etc.: secedo, secerno, segrego; seditio.</sense></entryFree>
singania: <entryFree id="n44373" type="main" key="Singani^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Singanĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n44373.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a river of Pontus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 4, 4, § 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
singara: <entryFree id="n44374" type="main" key="Singa^ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Singăra</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n44374.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city of Mesopotamia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the capital of the</hi> Arabes Prætavi, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 24, 21, § 86</bibl>.—Hence, <pos>adj.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Singărē-nus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Singara</hi>: congressiones, Sext. <bibl default="NO"><author>Ruf.</author> Brev. 27</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
singentiana: <entryFree id="n44375" type="main" key="Singenti^a_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Singentĭāna</orth> <itype>rādix</itype>, <sense id="n44375.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, = acoros, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
singidonensis: <entryFree id="n44376" type="main" key="Singidonensis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Singidonensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n44376.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the town Singido in Pannonia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Epit. 44" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Epit. 44</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
singili: <entryFree id="n44377" type="main" key="Singi^li"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Singĭli</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n44377.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city in</hi> Hispania Bætica, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 1, 3, § 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
singilio: <entryFree id="n44378" type="hapax" key="singi^li^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">singĭlĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, perh. <sense id="n44378.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">short garment</hi>, Gallien. ap. Treb. <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> 17</bibl> dub.</sense></entryFree>
singillariter: <entryFree id="n44379" type="main" key="singilla_ri^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">singillārĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. singulariter.</entryFree>
singillarius: <entryFree id="n44380" type="main" key="singilla_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">singillārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>singularis</etym>, <sense id="n44380.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">single</hi>, <hi rend="ital">simple</hi> (post - class.): <cit><quote lang="la">motus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ductus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> adv. Valent. 18</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
singillatim: <entryFree id="n44381" type="main" key="singilla_tim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">singillātim</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">singŭlātim</orth> (in many MSS. also <orth extent="full" lang="la">sigillātim</orth>; contr. collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">singultim</orth>), <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>singuli</etym>, <sense id="n44381.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one</hi> <pb n="1707" /> <cb n="SING" /> <hi rend="ital">by one</hi>, <hi rend="ital">singly</hi> (class.): sic singillatim nostrum unusquisque movetur, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 176, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">singillatim potius quam generatim atque universe loqui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:55:section=143" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 55, § 143</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">singillatim de uno quoque genere dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:30:49" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 1, 30, 49</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 8</bibl> (9), 43; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:153" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 153</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:105" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 105</bibl>; Caecil. and Cael. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 176, 8 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:1:52:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 1, 52, 98</bibl> and 99; 1, 55, 107; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:33:94" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 33, 94</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:36:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 36, 92</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:15:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Div. in Caecil. 15, 50</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">22, 72</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 2</bibl> Oud. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.;</hi> 5, 4; 5, 52; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 49:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 49, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:9" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:29" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Claud. 29</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
singlariter: <entryFree id="n44382" type="main" key="singla_ri^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">singlārĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. singularis <sense id="n44382.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
singos: <entryFree id="n44383" type="main" key="Singos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Singos</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Siggos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*si/ggos</foreign>, <sense id="n44383.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city of Chalcidice</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the Ægean Sea</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 10, 17, § 37</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
singularie: <entryFree id="n44384" type="main" key="singu^la_ri^e_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">singŭlārĭē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. singularius <sense id="n44384.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
singularis: <entryFree id="n44385" type="main" key="singu^la_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">singŭlāris</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>singuli</etym>. <sense id="n44385.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n44385.1" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">one by one</hi>, <hi rend="ital">one at a time</hi>, <hi rend="ital">alone</hi>, <hi rend="ital">single</hi>, <hi rend="ital">solitary; alone of its kind</hi>, <hi rend="ital">singular</hi> (class.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: unus, unicus): non singulare nec solivagum genus (sc. homines),</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>solitary</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:25:39" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 25, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostes ubi ex litore aliquos singulares ex navi egredientes conspexerant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 8, 3</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">homo (with privatus, and opp. isti conquisiti coloni),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:35:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 35, 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">singularis mundus atque unigena,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Univ. 4 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeconium Dei singularis facere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 4, 4, 8</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 1, 7, 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">natus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:153" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 10, 42, § 153</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">herba (opp. fruticosa),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 27, 9, 55, § 78</bibl></cit>: singularis ferus, <hi rend="ital">a wild boar</hi> (hence, Fr. <hi rend="ital">sanglier</hi>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:79:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 79, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hominem dominandi cupidum aut imperii singularis,</quote> <trans><tr>sole command</tr>, <tr>exclusive dominion</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:33:50" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 33, 50</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">singulare imperium et potestas regia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 9, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sunt quaedam in te singularia ... quaedam tibi cum multis communia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:88:section=206" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 88, § 206</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">singulare beneficium (opp. commune officium civium),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:9:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 9, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">odium (opp. communis invidia),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam invisa sit singularis potentia et miseranda vita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Dion, 9:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dion, 9, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pugna,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 5, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quando quid secreto agere proposuisset, erat illi locus in edito singularis,</quote> <trans><tr>particular</tr>, <tr>separate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:72" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 72</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44385.2" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n44385.3" n="1" level="3"> In gram., <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to unity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">singular</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">singularis casus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=33" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 33</bibl></cit> Müll.; <cit><quote lang="la">10, § 54 ib.: numerus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:42" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 5, 42</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:6:25" default="NO">1, 6, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:20" default="NO">8, 3, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:8:13" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 19, 8, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nominativus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:6:14" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 6, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">genitivus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:6:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 6, 26</bibl></cit> et saep. —Also <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the singular number</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">alii dicunt in singulari hac ovi et avi, alii hac ove et ave,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 8:section=66" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 8, § 66</bibl></cit> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:28" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 6, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:5:25 al" default="NO">4, 5, 25 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n44385.4" n="2" level="3"> In milit lang., <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">singŭlāris</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> </sense><sense id="n44385.5" n="a" level="4"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">an orderly man</hi> (ordonance), <hi rend="ital">assigned to officers of all kinds and ranks for executing their orders</hi> (called apparitor, <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Alex. Sev. 52</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">SINGVLARIS COS (consulis),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2003</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 3529 sq.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3591</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6771 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n44385.6" n="b" level="4"> Esp., under the emperors, equites singulares Augusti, or only equites singulares, <hi rend="ital">a select horse body-guard</hi> (selected from barbarous nations, as Bessi, Thraces, Bæti, etc.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 70</bibl>; Hyg. m. c. §§ 23 and 30; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 1041, 12 al.</bibl>; cf. on the Singulares, Henzen, Sugli Equiti Singolari, Roma, 1850; Becker, Antiq. tom. 3, pass. 2, p. 387 sq.—</sense><sense id="n44385.7" n="3" level="3"> In the time of the later emperors, singulares, <hi rend="ital">a kind of imperial clerks</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sent into the provinces</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 1, 27, 1, § 8</bibl>; cf. Lyd. Meg. 3, 7.—</sense><sense id="n44385.8" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">singular</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unique</hi>, <hi rend="ital">matchless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unparalleled</hi>, <hi rend="ital">extraordinary</hi>, <hi rend="ital">remarkable</hi> (syn.: unicus, eximius, praestans; <cit><quote lang="la">very freq. both in a good and in a bad sense): Aristoteles meo judicio in philosophiā prope singularis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 43, 132</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cato, summus et singularis vir,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:85:293" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 85, 293</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vir ingenii naturā praestans, singularis perfectusque undique,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:1:25" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 1, 25</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">homines ingenio atque animo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:47:97" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 47, 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adulescens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:7:24:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 7, 24, 2</bibl></cit>.—Of things: <cit><quote lang="la">Antonii incredibilis quaedam et prope singularis et divina vis ingenii videtur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:38:172" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 38, 172</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">singularis eximiaque virtus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Imp. Pomp. 1, 3</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">singularis et incredibilis virtus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:15:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 14, 15, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:9:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 9, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">integritas atque innocentia singularis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:9:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Div. in Caecil. 9, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Treviri, quorum inter Gallos virtutis opinio est singularis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pompeius gratias tibi agit singulares,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:41:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 41, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">mihi gratias egistis singularibus verbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 4, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fides,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">singulare omnium saeculorum exemplum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:4:6" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 2, 4, 6</bibl></cit>.—In a bad sense: <cit><quote lang="la">nequitia ac turpitudo singularis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 44</bibl></cit>, <cb n="SING" /> § 106; so, <cit><quote lang="la">nequitia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 54</bibl></cit>, § 134; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:20:56" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 20, 56</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">impudentia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:7:section=18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 7, § 18</bibl></cit>: audacia (with scelus incredibile), id. Fragm. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:105" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 105</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">singularis et nefaria crudelitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 77</bibl></cit>.— <itype>Hence</itype>, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">singŭlārĭter</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">singlā-rĭter</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1067" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 1067</bibl>). </sense><sense id="n44385.9" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">One by one</hi>, <hi rend="ital">singly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">separately.</hi> </sense><sense id="n44385.10" n="a" level="4"> In gen. (ante- and post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">quae memorare queam inter se singlariter apta, Lucr. l. l. Munro (Lachm. singillariter): a juventā singulariter sedens,</quote> <trans><tr>apart</tr>, <tr>separately</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Carm. 21, 727</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44385.11" n="b" level="4"> In partic. (acc. to I. B. 1.), <hi rend="ital">in the singular number</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod pluralia singulariter et singularia pluraliter efferuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:16" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 5, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:7:18" default="NO">1, 7, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:20" default="NO">9, 3, 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dici,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:8:12" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 19, 8, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:27:6:1 al" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 27, 6, 1 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n44385.12" n="2" level="3"> (Acc. to II.) <hi rend="ital">Particularly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exceedingly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem diligere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:47:section=117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 47, § 117</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et miror et diligo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:22:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 22, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 4:15:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 15, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
singularitas: <entryFree id="n44386" type="main" key="singu^la_ri^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">singŭlārĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>singularis</etym>. <sense id="n44386.0" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">a being alone</hi> or <hi rend="ital">single</hi>, <hi rend="ital">singleness</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Valent. 37</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Anim. 13</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Exhort. ad Cast. 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Salv.</author> Cont. Avar. 7, p. 70</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44386.1" n="II" level="1"> In partic., in gram., <hi rend="ital">the singular number</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 72</bibl> P.—</sense><sense id="n44386.2" n="III" level="1"> In arithmetic, <hi rend="ital">unity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the number one</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">singularitas omnibus mensura communis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 7</bibl></cit>, §§ 750 and 774.</sense></entryFree>
singulariter: <entryFree id="n44387" type="main" key="singu^la_ri^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">singŭlārĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. singularis <sense id="n44387.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
singularius: <entryFree id="n44388" type="main" key="si^ngu^la_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĭngŭlārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>singularis</etym>. <sense id="n44388.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">single</hi>, <hi rend="ital">separate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">alone of its kind</hi>, <hi rend="ital">peculiar</hi> (ante- and post-class. for the class. singularis; but cf. <itype>infra</itype>, <pos>adv.</pos>): homo unicā est naturā ac singulariā, Turp. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 491, 2</bibl>: litterae, i. e. <hi rend="ital">abbreviations</hi> (syn. sigla), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:9:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 9, 2</bibl>: catenae, perh. <hi rend="ital">of a single ply</hi>, = simplices (or <hi rend="ital">of a pound weight</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">light;</hi> opp. istas majores, v. 4; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">centenariae ballistae),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:1:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 1, 2, 3</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n44388.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Remarkable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">extraordinary</hi>, <hi rend="ital">singular</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">homines singulariae velocitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:9:4:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 9, 4, 6</bibl></cit>. —* <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">singŭlārĭē</orth> = singulariter: <cit><quote lang="la">singularie pro singulariter quasi unice, Cicero, ut Maximus notat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 195</bibl></cit> P.</sense></entryFree>
singulatim: <entryFree id="n44389" type="main" key="singu^la_tim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">singŭlātim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. singillatim.</entryFree>
singuli: <entryFree id="n44390" type="main" key="singu^li"><orth extent="full" lang="la">singŭli</orth>, <itype>ae, a</itype> (in <number>sing.</number> only ante- and post-class.; <sense id="n44390.0" n="I" level="1"><xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr>), <hi rend="ital">num. distr. adj.</hi> [cf. simul, v. simplex]. </sense><sense id="n44390.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">One to each</hi>, <hi rend="ital">separate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">single</hi> (opp. universi; <cit><quote lang="la">for syn. cf.: privus, unusquisque): vini in culleos singulos quadragenae et singulae urnae dabuntur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 148, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut ad denas capras singulos parent hircos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:3" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">binae singulis quae datae nobis ancillae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">describebat censores binos in singulas civitates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:53:section=133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 53, § 133</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">duodena describit in singulos homines jugera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:31:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 31, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">filiae singulos filios parvos habentes,</quote> <trans><tr>each one a boy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 4, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">croci, myrrhae, singulorum (tantum), etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>of each</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:6:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 6, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">singuli singulorum deorum sacerdotes,</quote> <trans><tr>a priest to each god</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:12:29" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 12, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quos ex omni copiā singuli singulos delegerant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 48</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si singuli singulos aggressuri fueritis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:18:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 18, 6</bibl></cit> et saep.—<hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nummo singulo multabatur (for which, shortly before: poena erat nummus unus sestertius),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:18:13:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 18, 13, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44390.2" n="b" level="4"> In dies singulos, adverb., <hi rend="ital">from day to day</hi>, <hi rend="ital">every day</hi>, <hi rend="ital">daily;</hi> cottidie vel potius in dies singulos breviores litteras ad te mitto, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 7, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">crescit in dies singulos hostium numerus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 1, 2, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:22:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 2, 22, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44390.3" n="II" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">single</hi>, <hi rend="ital">separate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">individual</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">populus rationi (obtemperare debet), nos singuli populo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 9:section=6" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 9, § 6</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">honestius eum (agrum) vos universi quam singuli possideretis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:31:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 31, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">antepono singulis (generibus rei publicae) illud, quod conflatum fuerit ex omnibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:35:54" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 35, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">refert, qui audiant ... frequentes an pauci an singuli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:55:211" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 55, 211</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut conquisitores singuli in subsellia Eant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:prol. 65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. prol. 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">singulorum dominatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:39:61" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 39, 61</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 40, 63</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 1, 2</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">proderit per se ipsum secedere: meliores erimus singuli,</quote> <trans><tr>alone</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ot. Sap. 1:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ot. Sap. 1, 1</bibl></cit> (<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Vit. Beat. 28:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vit. Beat. 28, 2</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">quod est miserrimum, numquam sumus singuli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 4:section=2 praef" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Q. N. 4, § 2 praef.</bibl></cit>—<hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi> (for the class. unus or singularis): <cit><quote lang="la">attat singulum video vestigium,</quote> <trans><tr>a single trace</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:4:2:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 4, 2, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de caelo et tritico non infitias eo, quin singulo semper numero dicenda sint,</quote> <trans><tr>in the singular number</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:8:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 19, 8, 5</bibl></cit>: semel unum singulum est, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 171, 20 al.</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 3, § 325</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
singultim: <entryFree id="n44391" type="main" key="singultim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">singultim</orth>. <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>from singultus; cf.: <cb n="SINI" /> furtim, partim, etc.</etym>, <sense id="n44391.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sobbingly</hi>: <foreign lang="greek">meta/ lugmou=</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:6:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 6, 56</bibl> (others less correctly make it = singulatim, singillatim, <hi rend="ital">singly</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">lamentabiles questus singultim instrepebat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M p. 127, 36</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
singultio: <entryFree id="n44392" type="main" key="singulti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">singultĭo</orth>, <itype>īre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>singultus</etym>. <sense id="n44392.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To hiccup</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aut bilem vomunt aut singultiunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:26:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 26, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 1, 24, § 48</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">to sob</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 3, p. 133, 40</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n44392.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of a hen, <hi rend="ital">to cluck</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:11:15" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 11, 15</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n44392.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to throb</hi> with pleasure: <cit><quote lang="la">vena,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:6:72" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 6, 72</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
singulto: <entryFree id="n44393" type="main" key="singulto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">singulto</orth>, no <sense id="n44393.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [id.]. </sense><sense id="n44393.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to hiccup; to sob</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">singultantium modo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:7:10" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 7, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44393.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <usg type="style">poet.</usg>, of persons dying, <hi rend="ital">to rattle</hi> in the throat, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:333" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 333</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:2:362" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 2, 362</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:1:388" default="NO">1, 388</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:2:211" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 2, 211</bibl>.—Of speech <hi rend="ital">interrupted with sobs</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba singultantia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:5:5:26" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 5, 5, 26</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0830,001:6:22" default="NO"><author>Calp.</author> Ecl. 6, 22</bibl>.—Of water flowing from an orifice, <hi rend="ital">to gurgle</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 2, 2 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl>—</sense><sense id="n44393.3" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>: animam, <hi rend="ital">to breathe out with sobs</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to gasp away</hi> with short sobs or rattling in the throat, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:134" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 134</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in limine vitae animas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:5:261" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 5, 261</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et singultatis oscula mixta sonis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:5:16" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 5, 16</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
singultus: <entryFree id="n44394" type="main" key="singultus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">singultus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>singuli, and hence, an uttering of single sounds</etym>. <sense id="n44394.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a sobbing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">speech interrupted by sobs</hi> (class.); <number>sing.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">multas lacrimas et fletum cum singultu videre potuisti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:31:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 31, 76</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1160" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 1160</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:420" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 420</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:3:42" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 1, 3, 42</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:10 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 10 al.</bibl>—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 131</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:509" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 509</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:27:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 27, 74</bibl>.—As a disease, <hi rend="ital">hiccups</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 47:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 47, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:189" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 17, 73, § 189</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:120" default="NO" valid="yes">21, 18, 72, § 120</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:54 al" default="NO" valid="yes">23, 1, 27, § 54 al.</bibl>— </sense><sense id="n44394.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a rattling in the throat</hi> of dying persons, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:415" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 415</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:507" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 3, 507</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Cons. ad Marc. 11:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Cons. ad Marc. 11, 4</bibl>.—Of the <hi rend="ital">clucking</hi> of a hen, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:5:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 5, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:11:15" default="NO">8, 11, 15</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 28, 6</bibl>.—Of the <hi rend="ital">croaking</hi> of a raven, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:362" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 35, 87, § 362</bibl>.—Of the <hi rend="ital">gurgling</hi> of water, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:30:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 4, 30, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
singulus: <entryFree id="n44395" type="main" key="singu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">singŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. singuli.</entryFree>
sinis: <entryFree id="n44396" type="main" key="Si^nis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sĭnis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*si/nis</foreign>, <sense id="n44396.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a mythical robber on the Isthmus of Corinth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who bound travellers to the tops of pine-trees which he had bent to the ground</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and then</hi>, <hi rend="ital">by letting go his hold</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hurled them into the air; he was killed at last by Theseus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3</bibl> (4), 22, 37; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:440" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 440</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:2:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 2, 70</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:12:576" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 12, 576</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sinister: <entryFree id="n44397" type="main" key="si^nister"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĭnister</orth>, <itype>tra, trum</itype> (<sense id="n44397.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">comp.</hi> sinisterior; <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi> sinistimus, Prisc. pp. 605 and 607 P.; Fest. s. v. dextimum, p. 74; and s. v. sinistrae, p. 339 Müll.), <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>etym. dub.; perh. from sinus (i. e. togae); cf. Pott, Etym. Forsch. 2, 555; the ending is a double comp. -is and -ter; cf.: magister, minister</etym>. </sense><sense id="n44397.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Left</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the left</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the left hand</hi> or <hi rend="ital">side</hi> (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">laevus, scaevus): manus sinistra (opp. dextra),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:114" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 114</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,014:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dat. 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:159" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 159</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">bracchium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:141" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 141</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">latus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:99" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 99</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">numerus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:93" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 93</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:113" default="NO">11, 3, 113</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:140" default="NO">11, 3, 140</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:125" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 125</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:159" default="NO">11, 3, 159</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cornu (opp. dextrum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:7:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 7, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 62</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 2, 34</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 67 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pars,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 2, 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 2, 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">angulus castrorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ripa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 2, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">calceus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:92" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tibia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:5:7:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 5, 7, 7</bibl></cit> et saep.—As <hi rend="ital">substt.</hi> </sense><sense id="n44397.2" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">sĭnistrum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (sc. latus), <hi rend="ital">the left side</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">reicere a sinistro togam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:144" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 144</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">in sinistrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:109" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 109</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:113" default="NO">11, 3, 113</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:114" default="NO">11, 3, 114</bibl>; 11, 3, 135.—</sense><sense id="n44397.3" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">sĭnistra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (sc. manus), <hi rend="ital">the left hand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the left</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sinistrā impeditā satis commode pugnare non poterant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 75 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:131" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 131</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:160" default="NO">11, 3, 160</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:21" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 89</bibl> et saep.—Used in stealing: <cit><quote lang="la">natae ad furta sinistrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 111</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:12:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 12, 1</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">hence, of a thief's accomplices: Porci et Socration, duae sinistrae Pisonis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:47:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 47, 1</bibl></cit>.—As bearing the shield and defending: <cit><quote lang="la">idem (Afer) per allegoriam M. Caelium melius obicientem crimina quam defendentem, Bonam dextram, malam sinistram habere dicebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:69" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 69</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n44397.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the left side</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cur a dextrā corvus, a sinistrā cornix faciat ratum?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:39:85" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 39, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aspicite a sinistrā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:6:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 6, 5, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aspice nunc ad sinistram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:5:2:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 5, 2, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub sinistrā Britanniam relictam conspexit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">miles dexterā ac sinistrā muro tectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 2, 15</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">innumerabiles supra infra, dextrā sinistrā, ante post ejusmodi mundos esse,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 40, 125</bibl></cit>.— Rarely in <number>plur.</number>: sinistris repentino consilio Poetelii consulis additae vires (opp. dextra <pb n="1708" /> <cb n="SINO" /> pars), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:27:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 27, 9</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in sinisteriore parte (= sinistrā),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 9:section=34" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 9, § 34</bibl></cit> Müll.; so, cornu (opp. dexterius), Galb. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:30:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 30, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">bracchium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:17" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mamma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 4, 1 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equus funalis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:6" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rota,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 139</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>, <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">supra</ref></xr> <hi rend="ital">init.</hi>—</sense><sense id="n44397.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n44397.6" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Awkward</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wrong</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perverse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">improper</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">mores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:347" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 347</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">liberalitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:29:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 29, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">instituta (Judaeorum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 5, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">natura (with prava),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:4:10" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 4, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44397.7" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Unlucky</hi>, <hi rend="ital">injurious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">adverse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unfavorable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ill</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bad</hi>, etc. (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">arboribus satisque Notus pecorique sinister,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:444" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 444</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">interpretatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sermones de Tiberio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 1, 74</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">sermones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:9:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 9, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fama eo de homine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 32</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">11, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 1, 51 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rumor lenti itineris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 93</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">diligentia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:7:28:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 7, 28, 3</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">pugna Cannensis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:3" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 3</bibl></cit> (4, 2), 9: <cit><quote lang="la">studii signa sinistra mei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:7:64" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 5, 7, 64</bibl></cit>; v. also infra, C. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>—With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Hannibal) fidei sinister,</quote> <trans><tr>faithless</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:1:56" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 1, 56</bibl></cit> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">pravos fidei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:253" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 253</bibl></cit>).—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">sĭnistrum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">evil</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(matrona) studiosa sinistri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:2:257" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 2, 257</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44397.8" n="C" level="2"> With respect to auspices and divination, acc. to the Roman notions, <hi rend="ital">lucky</hi>, <hi rend="ital">favorable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">auspicious</hi> (because the Romans on these occasions turned the face towards the south, and so had the eastern or fortunate side on the left; while the Greeks, turning to the north, had it on their right; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">dexter, II. 2.): ita nobis sinistra videntur, Graiis et barbaris dextra, meliora. Quamquam haud ignoro, quae bona sint, sinistra nos dicere, etiam si dextra sint, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:39:82" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 39, 82</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">fulmen sinistrum auspicium optimum habemus ad omnes res praeterquam ad comitia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 35, 74</bibl></cit> (with this cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:38:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 38, 99</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">liquido exeo foras Auspicio, avi sinistra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:2:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 2</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">avi sinistra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:2:4:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 2, 4, 72</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">cornix,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:9:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 9, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">volatus avium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:5:3" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 5, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tonitrus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:9:49" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 9, 49</bibl></cit>.—Sometimes in the Greek sense (or in direct reference to the signif. B.), <hi rend="ital">unlucky</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unfavorable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inauspicious</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">di, precor, a nobis omen removete sinistrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:13:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 13, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">avibus sinistris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:2:115" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 115</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sinistris auspiciis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:4:7:2" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 4, 7, 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fulmen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:38:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 38, 99</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sinistram approbationem (opp. dextram),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:45:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 45, 8</bibl></cit> and 17; <cit><quote lang="la">cf: sinistro pede proficisci,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 1, p. 104, 23</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">sĭnistrē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">badly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wrongly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perversely</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">derisum semel exceptumque sinistre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:452" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 452</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">accipere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 52</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non tam sinistre constitutum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:45:5" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 45, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sinisteritas: <entryFree id="n44398" type="main" key="si^niste^ri^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĭnistĕrĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>sinister, II. A.</etym>, <sense id="n44398.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">awkwardness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">untowardness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perversity</hi> (cf. the opp. dexteritas); perh. only in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:6:17:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 6, 17, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 5, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sinistimus: <entryFree id="n44399" type="gloss" key="si^nisti^mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĭnistĭmus</orth>, v. sinister <sense id="n44399.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
sinistra: <entryFree id="n44400" type="main" key="si^nistra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĭnistra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. sinister, I. 2.</entryFree>
sinistre: <entryFree id="n44401" type="main" key="si^nistre_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĭnistrē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. sinister, II. C. <sense id="n44401.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
sinistrorsus: <entryFree id="n44402" type="main" key="si^nistrorsus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĭnistrorsus</orth> (collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">sĭnis-trorsum</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:9:20" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 9, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 3, 50</bibl>; and not contr. <orth extent="full" lang="la">sĭnistrōversus</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 3, 6, 4</bibl>), <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>contr. from sinistrovorsus, from sinister-vorto</etym>, <sense id="n44402.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">towards the left side</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to the left</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hinc (Hercynia silva) se flectit sinistrorsus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:4" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Galb. 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Aquaed. 5" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Aquaed. 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">portu latent Puppes sinistrorsum citae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:9:20" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 9, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ille sinistrorsum, hic dextrorsum abit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 3, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dextro aut sinistroversus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 3, 6, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sinistroversus: <entryFree id="n44403" type="main" key="si^nistro_versus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĭnistrōversus</orth>, v. sinistrorsus <sense id="n44403.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
sinnius: <entryFree id="n44404" type="main" key="Sinni^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sinnĭus</orth>, <itype>ia</itype>, <sense id="n44404.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a Roman</hi> gens, e. g. Sinnius Capito, <hi rend="ital">a Roman grammarian</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:21:9" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 5, 21, 9</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sinnĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of Sinnius</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">opinio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:21:14" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 5, 21, 14</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sino: <entryFree id="n44405" type="main" key="si^no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĭno</orth>, <itype>sīvi, sĭtum, 3</itype> (sinit, as archaic <sense id="n44405.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">subj. pres.</hi> formerly stood, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:1:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 1, 1, 27</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> Cir. 239</bibl>; but in the former passage has been corrected to sierit, Fleck.; and in the latter the clause is spurious.— <hi rend="ital">Perf.</hi> sii, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 371</bibl> P.: <cit><quote lang="la">siit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:1:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 1, 2, 24</bibl></cit>, acc. to Diom. l. l.; another old form of the <hi rend="ital">perf.</hi> sini, Scaur. ap. Diom. l. l.; so, too, <hi rend="ital">pluperf.</hi> sinisset, Rutil. ib.— Sync. <hi rend="ital">perf.</hi> sisti, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:2:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 2, 80</bibl>: sistis, Att. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:57:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 57, 122</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Subj.</hi> sieris or siris, Pac. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:44:106" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 44, 106</bibl>; cf.
