Trag. Rel. p. 84 Rib.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 3, 2, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:3:3:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 3, 3, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:4:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 2, 4, 120</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">an old formula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sirit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:28:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 28, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:34:24" default="NO" valid="yes">28, 34, 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">siritis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:1:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 5, 1, 20</bibl></cit>: sirint, id. <cb n="SINO" /> Bacch. 3, 3, 64; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:3:4:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 3, 4, 28</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Pluperf.</hi> sisset, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sissent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:19:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 19, 44</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes">35, 5, 11</bibl>), <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>etym. dub.</etym>, orig., <hi rend="ital">to let</hi>, <hi rend="ital">put</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lay</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">set down;</hi> found so only in the <pos>P. a.</pos> situs (v. <itype>infra</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>), and in the compound pono (for posino, v. pono); cf. also 2. situs, I.—Hence, transf., and freq. in all styles and periods. </sense><sense id="n44405.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to let</hi>, <hi rend="ital">suffer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">allow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">permit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">give leave</hi> (syn.: permitto, patior, tolero, fero); constr. usually with an <hi rend="ital">obj.-clause</hi>, the <hi rend="ital">subj.</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>, rarely with <hi rend="ital">ut</hi> or an <case>acc.</case> </sense><sense id="n44405.2" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">obj.clause</hi>: exsulare sinitis, sistis pelli, pulsum patimini, Att. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:57:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 57, 122</bibl>: neu reliquias sic meas sieris denudatis ossibus foede divexarier, Pac. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:44:106" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 44, 106</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quin tu itiner exsequi meum me sinis?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:5:2:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 5, 2, 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nos Transalpinas gentes oleam et vitem serere non sinimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:9:16" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 3, 9, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non sinam tum nobis denique responderi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:17:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 1, 17, 54</bibl></cit> B. and K.: <cit><quote lang="la">praecipitem amicum ferri sinere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:24:89" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 24, 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">latrocinium in Syriam penetrare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:11:13:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 11, 13, 32</bibl></cit>: vinum ad se importari, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Medos equitare inultos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:2:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 2, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnum corpus Crescere sinito,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:206" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 206</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:3:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 3, 3, 11</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Cato contionatus est, se comitia haberi non siturum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:6:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 6, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sine sis loqui me,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:3:2:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 3, 2, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sine me dum istuc judicare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:5:2:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 5, 2, 22</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">sine dum petere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:7:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 2, 7, 67</bibl></cit> et saep.—<hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinum in dolium conditur et ibi sinitur fermentari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:17:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 17, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque is tamen inire sinitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:37:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 37, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitis suci gratiā exire sinitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 1, 3, § 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic accusare eum moderate, per senatus auctoritatem non est situs,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:44:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 44, 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sine te exorari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:9:21:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 9, 21, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44405.3" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">subj.</hi> (so for the most part only in the <hi rend="ital">imper.</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">sine te exorem, sine te prendam auriculis, sine dem savium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:163" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 163</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sine me expurgem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:5:3:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 5, 3, 29</bibl></cit>: <hi rend="ital">Ch.</hi> At tandem dicat sine. <hi rend="ital">Si.</hi> Age dicat; <cit><quote lang="la">sino,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 3, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne duit, si non vult: sic sine astet,</quote> <trans><tr>let him stand</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:4:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 4, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sine pascat durus (captivus) aretque,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 16, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sine vivat ineptus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 17, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sine sciam,</quote> <trans><tr>let me know</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:40:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 40, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sinite abeam viva a vobis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:2:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 2, 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sinite instaurata revisam Proelia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:669" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 669</bibl></cit> et saep.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg> in the <hi rend="ital">verb. finit</hi>: natura repugnat; <cit><quote lang="la">Nec sinit incipiat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:377" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 377</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44405.4" n="(g)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg> (syn.: pati, ferre); <cit><quote lang="la">suspende, vinci, verbera: auctor sum, sino,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:1:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 1, 1, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nobiscum versari jam diutius non potes: non feram, non patiar, non sinam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 1, 5, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domum ire cupio: at uxor non sinit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:5:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 5, 60</bibl></cit>: <hi rend="ital">Ba.</hi> Ego nolo dare te quicquam. <hi rend="ital">Pi.</hi> Sine. <hi rend="ital">Ba.</hi> Sino equidem, si lubet, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:1:1:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 1, 1, 66</bibl>: nate, cave; <cit><quote lang="la">dum resque sinit, tua corrige vota,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">moretur ergo in libertate sinentibus nobis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 4, 10 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n44405.5" n="(d)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sivi, animum ut expleret suom,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 2, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sinite, exorator ut sim, id. Hec. prol. alt. 2: neque sinam, ut,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 2, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec dii siverint, ut hoc decus demere mihi quisquam possit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:8:13" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 8, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque di sinant ut Belgarum decus istud sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 43</bibl></cit>.— (<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sinite arma viris et cedite ferro,</quote> <trans><tr>leave arms to men</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:620" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 620</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per te, vir Trojane, sine hanc animam et miserere precantis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 598</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neu propius tectis taxum sine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 4, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">serpentium multitudo nisi hieme transitum non sinit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 14, 17, § 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">at id nos non sinemus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:5:5:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 5, 5, 7</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">non sinat hoc Ajax,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:219" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 219</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">7, 174</bibl>.—Sometimes the <case>acc.</case> is used elliptically, as in Engl., and an <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> (to be, remain, do, go, etc.) is to be supplied: <hi rend="ital">Sy.</hi> Sineres vero tu illum tuum Facere haec? <hi rend="ital">De.</hi> Sinerem illum! <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:3:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 3, 3, 42</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum interea sic sit, istuc actutum sino,</quote> <trans><tr>I'll let that by and by go</tr>, <tr>I don't care for it</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:1:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 1, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">me in tabernā usque adhuc sineret Syrus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:7:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 4, 7, 14</bibl></cit>: <hi rend="ital">Ch.</hi> Ne labora. <hi rend="ital">Me.</hi> Sine me, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:1:1:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 1, 1, 38</bibl>: quisquis es, sine me, <hi rend="ital">let me</hi> (<hi rend="ital">go</hi>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. 3, 2, 23</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44405.6" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n44405.7" n="A" level="2"> In colloquial language. </sense><sense id="n44405.8" n="1" level="3"> Sine, <hi rend="ital">let</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sine veniat!</quote> <trans><tr>let him come!</tr></trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 6, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">insani feriant sine litora fluctus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:9:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 9, 43</bibl></cit>.—So simply sine! <hi rend="ital">be it so! granted! very well! agreed</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">pulchre ludificor. Sine!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:8:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 8, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:5:2:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 5, 2, 48</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:3:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 3, 2, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:7:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 4, 7, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:3:90 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 3, 90 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic sine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 5, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44405.9" n="2" level="3"> Sine modo, <hi rend="ital">only</hi> <cb n="SINO" /> <hi rend="ital">let</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">if only</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cur me verberas? ... Patiar. Sine modo adveniat senex! Sine modo venire salvum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 1, 10</bibl></cit>.—So with <hi rend="ital">subj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sine modo venias domum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:5:2:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 5, 2, 50</bibl></cit> Fleck.—</sense><sense id="n44405.10" n="B" level="2"> Rarely like the Greek <foreign lang="greek">e)a=n</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">to give up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cease</hi>, <hi rend="ital">leave</hi> a thing <hi rend="ital">undone: Al.</hi> Vin vocem? <hi rend="ital">Cl.</hi> Sine: <cit><quote lang="la">nolo, si occupata est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:3:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 3, 2, 14</bibl></cit>: tum certare odiis, tum res rapuisse licebit. Nunc sinite (sc. certare, etc.), <hi rend="ital">forbear</hi>, Verg A. 10, 15.—</sense><sense id="n44405.11" n="C" level="2"> Ne di sirint (sinant), ne Juppiter sirit, etc., <hi rend="ital">God forbid! Heaven forefend! Ch.</hi> Hoc capital facis ... aequalem et sodalem liberum civem enicas. <hi rend="ital">Eu.</hi> Ne di sirint, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:3:4:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 3, 4, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:3:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 3, 3, 64</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">for which: ne di siverint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:2:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 2, 2, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illud nec di sinant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne istuc Juppiter O. M. sirit, urbem, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:28:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 28, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec me ille sierit Juppiter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:1:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 1, 1, 27</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">sĭtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">placed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">set</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lying</hi>, <hi rend="ital">situate</hi> (syn. positus; freq. and class.). </sense><sense id="n44405.12" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n44405.13" n="1" level="3"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">(gallinis) meridie bibere dato nec plus aqua sita siet horam unam,</quote> <trans><tr>nor let the water be set before them more than an hour</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pluma Quae sita cervices circum collumque coronat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:802" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 802</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(aurum) probe in latebris situm,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 4, 2, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 2, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">proba merx facile emptorem reperit, tametsi in abstruso sita est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 129</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Romuli lituus, cum situs esset in curiā Saliorum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:17:30" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 17, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in ore sita lingua est finita dentibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:59:149" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 59, 149</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter duo genua naribus sitis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:183" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 64, 84, § 183</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ara sub dio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:240" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 107, 111, § 240</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sitae fuere et Thespiades (statuae) ad aedem Felicitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 36, 5, 4, § 39</bibl></cit> et saep.—Rarely of persons: <cit><quote lang="la">quin socios, amicos procul juxtaque sitos trahunt exciduntque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 4:61:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. 4, 61, 17</bibl></cit> Dietsch; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">jam fratres, jam propinquos, jam longius sitos caedibus exhaustos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nobilissimi totius Britanniae eoque in ipsis penetralibus siti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cis Rhenum sitarum gentium animos confirmavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:120:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 120, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">gens in convallibus sita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 2, 2, § 28</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44405.14" n="2" level="3"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n44405.15" n="a" level="4"> Of places, <hi rend="ital">lying</hi>, <hi rend="ital">situate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">locus in mediā insulā situs,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:48:section=106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 48, § 106</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in quo (sinu) sita Carthago est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:24:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 24, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbes in orā Graeciae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Alcib. 5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Alcib. 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbs ex adverso (Carthaginis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 1, 1, § 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">insulae ante promunturium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:180" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 59, 85, § 180</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regio contra Parthiae tractum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 16, 18, § 46</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n44405.16" n="b" level="4"> Of the dead, <hi rend="ital">lying</hi>, <hi rend="ital">laid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">buried</hi>, <hi rend="ital">interred</hi> (syn. conditus): <cit><quote lang="la">declarat Ennius de Africano, hic est ille situs. Vere: nam siti dicuntur hi, qui conditi sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:22:57" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 22, 57</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">redditur terrae corpus et ita locatum ac situm quasi operimento matris obducitur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 22, 56</bibl></cit>: siticines appellati qui apud sitos canere soliti essent, hoc est vitā functos et sepultos, Atei. Capito ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:20:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 20, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">C. Marii sitae reliquiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:2:56" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 2, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Aeneas) situs est ... super Numicium flumen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 2</bibl></cit> Drak.: <cit><quote lang="la">Cn. Terentium offendisse arcam, in quā Numa situs fuisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 13, 27, § 84</bibl></cit>.—Hence the common phrase in epitaphs: <cit><quote lang="la">HIC SITVS EST, HIC SITI SVNT, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 654</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4639</bibl> sq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:3:2:29" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 3, 2, 29</bibl>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Comically: noli minitari: scio crucem futuram mihi sepulcrum: Ibi mei sunt majores siti, pater, avus, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:4:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 4, 20</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44405.17" n="c" level="4"> A few times in Tacitus for conditus, <hi rend="ital">built</hi>, <hi rend="ital">founded</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbem Philippopolim, a Macedone Philippo sitam circumsidunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 38 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">6, 41</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">veterem aram Druso sitam disjecerant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 7</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vallum duabus legionibus situm,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 4, 22</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44405.18" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n44405.19" n="1" level="3"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">placed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">situated</hi>, <hi rend="ital">present</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ready</hi>: hoc erit tibi argumentum semper in promptu situm, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:29:20" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 29, 20</bibl> (Sat. v. 37 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">in melle sunt linguae sitae vostrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:1:2:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 1, 2, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae ceteris in artibus aut studiis sita sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:15:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 15, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quas (artes) semper in te intellexi sitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 1, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(voluptates) in medio sitas esse dicunt,</quote> <trans><tr>within the reach of all</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:33:94" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 33, 94</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44405.20" n="2" level="3"> In partic.: situm esse in aliquo or in aliquā re, <hi rend="ital">to rest with</hi>, <hi rend="ital">depend upon some one</hi> or <hi rend="ital">something</hi> (a favorite figure with Cic., and found not unfreq. in other writers): <cit><quote lang="la">in patris potestate est situm,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:1:1:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 1, 1, 52</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">assensio quae est in nostrā potestate sita,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 12, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hujusce rei potestas omnis in vobis sita est, judices,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:39:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 39, 83</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">huic ipsi (Archiae), quantum est situm in nobis, opem ferre debemus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:chapter=1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Arch. 1</bibl></cit>, <pb n="1709" /> <cb n="SINU" /> 1: <cit><quote lang="la">est situm in nobis, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:17:57" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 17, 57</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also: si causa appetitus non est sita in nobis, ne ipse quidem appetitus est in nostrā potestate, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:17:40" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fat. 17, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">summam eruditionem Graeci sitam censebant in nervorum vocumque cantibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:2:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in officio colendo sita vitae est honestas omnis et in neglegendo turpitudo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:2:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui omnem vim divinam in naturā sitam esse censet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:13:35" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 13, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cui spes omnis in fugā sita erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 54:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 54, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in armis omnia sita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 51:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 51, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in unius pernicie ejus patriae sitam putabant salutem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Epam. 9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Epam. 9</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">res omnis in incerto sita est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 4</bibl></cit>. 4: <cit><quote lang="la">tu in eo sitam vitam beatam putas?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:12:35" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 12, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam si pugnandum est, quo consilio in temporibus situm est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:9:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 7, 9, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laus in medio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 18</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sinon: <entryFree id="n44406" type="main" key="sinon1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sinon</orth>, <sense id="n44406.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an unknown herb</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 13, 109, § 136</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n44407" type="main" key="Si^non2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sĭnon</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n44407.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">son of Æsimus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">through whose perfidy the Trojans were induced to take the wooden horse within their city</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:79 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 79 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 108" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 108</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Dict. Cret.</author> 5, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:202" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 56, 57, § 202</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sinonia: <entryFree id="n44408" type="main" key="Sino_ni^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sinōnĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n44408.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an island in the Tyrrhenian Sea</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Sanone</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:7" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 6, 12, § 81</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sinope: <entryFree id="n44409" type="main" key="Si^no_pe_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sĭnōpē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype> (or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-a</orth>, ae; cf. Zumpt ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:34:section=87, p. 166" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 34, § 87, p. 166</bibl>), <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*sinw/ph</foreign>. <sense id="n44409.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A famous Greek colony in Paphlagonia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the Euxine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the birthplace of Diogenes the Cynic and residence of Mithridates</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Sinoub</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:19:9" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 19, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 2, 2, § 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:34:section=87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 34, § 87</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:8:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Imp. Pomp. 8, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:83 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 83 sq.</bibl> al.: <cit><quote lang="la">Sinopae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:20:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 20, 53</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n44409.1" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sĭnōpensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Sinope</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">colonia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:15:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 15, 1</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.—Plur. subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sĭnōpenses</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Sinope</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 83 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—</sense><sense id="n44409.2" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sĭnōpeus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">*sinwpeu/s</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">of Sinope</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:3:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 3, 72</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cynicus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Diogenes</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:3:67" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 1, 3, 67</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n44409.3" n="3" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sĭnōpĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of Sinope</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">minium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:6:6:19" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 6, 19</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44409.4" n="4" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sĭnōpis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (sc. terra), <hi rend="ital">a kind of red ochre</hi> found in Sinope, and used for coloring, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 6, 13, § 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 7, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> 2, 16, 3</bibl> and 5.— </sense><sense id="n44409.5" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An earlier name for the town of</hi> Sinuessa, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:21:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 21, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sinti: <entryFree id="n44410" type="main" key="Sinti"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sinti</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sintii</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n44410.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of Macedonia</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Heraclea ex Sintiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:51:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 51, 7</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sintĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the</hi> Sintii, <hi rend="ital">Sintian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Heraclea Sintica,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 10, 17, § 35</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">or, Sintice Heraclea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:29:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 29, 6</bibl></cit> and 7.</sense></entryFree>
sinuamen: <entryFree id="n44411" type="main" key="si^nu^a_men"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĭnŭāmen</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>sinuo</etym>, <sense id="n44411.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a bending</hi>, <hi rend="ital">turning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">winding</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Psych. 870</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Juvenc.</author> 1, 87</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 56</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Carm. 22, 151</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sinuatio: <entryFree id="n44412" type="main" key="si^nu^a_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĭnŭātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n44412.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a bending</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bend</hi>, <hi rend="ital">curve</hi>: corniculata lunae, Fulg. Myth. praef.</sense></entryFree>
sinuessa: <entryFree id="n44413" type="main" key="Si^nu^essa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sĭnŭessa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n44413.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a colony of the Latins</hi>, <hi rend="ital">formerly called Sinope</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in Campania</hi>, now ruins near <hi rend="ital">Monte Dragone</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:4:9" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 4, 9</bibl>. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 9, § 59</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:21:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 21, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 15</bibl>, A, 6; 9, 16, 1; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:715" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 715</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sĭnŭessuānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Sinuessa</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">deversoriolum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 12, 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 14, 8, 1</bibl>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">mansi in Sinuessano,</quote> <trans><tr>the Sinuessan estate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 15, 1</bibl></cit>, B, 1: <cit><quote lang="la">aquae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 2, 4, § 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:208" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 93, 94, § 208</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">lacus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:7:12" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 11, 7, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:13:11:1" default="NO">13, 11, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Petrinum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 5, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sinum: <entryFree id="n44414" type="main" key="si_num"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sīnum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (<sense id="n44414.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">masc.</hi> collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">sīnus</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:1:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 1, 1, 82</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:5:2:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 5, 2, 31</bibl>; for the form of the <case>abl.</case>, sinu, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 547, 23</bibl>, we should perh. substitute sino; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 714</bibl> P.) [1. sinus], <hi rend="ital">a large</hi>, <hi rend="ital">round drinking-vessel with swelling sides</hi> (like our <hi rend="ital">bowls</hi>), esp. for wine (cf. Cic. Fragm. ap. Schol. Veron. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:7:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 7, 33</bibl>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=123" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 123</bibl> Müll.; id. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 547, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:1:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 1, 1, 75</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 1, 82</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:5:2:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 5, 2, 32</bibl>; Atta ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. E. 7, 33</bibl>; Valgius ap. Philarg. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:177" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 177</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:8:2 al" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 8, 2 al.</bibl>; cf. Becker, Gallus, 3, p. 225 (2d edit.).</sense></entryFree>
sinuo: <entryFree id="n44415" type="main" key="si^nu^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĭnŭo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n44415.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to bend</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wind</hi>, <hi rend="ital">curve; to bow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to swell out in curves</hi> (perh. not ante-Aug.; most freq. in the poets; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: curvo, flecto): (anguis) sinuat immensa volumine terga,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:208" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 208</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">flexos corpus in orbes (anguis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(equus) sinuet alterna volumina crurum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:192" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 192</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imposito patulos calamo sinuaverat arcus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>had bent</tr>, <tr>stretched</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 30</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">arcum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:8:381" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 381</bibl></cit>: nervum, Sen. Herc. <cb n="SINU" /> Fur. 1198: <cit><quote lang="la">Euphraten immensum attolli et in modum diadematis sinuare orbes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(anguis) immensos saltu sinuatur in arcus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 42</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">gurges curvos sinuatus in arcus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:14:51" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cornua Lunae sinuantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:3:682" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 682</bibl></cit>; 14, 501; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 8, 1 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl>: muri per artem obliqui aut introrsus sinuati, <hi rend="ital">bent inwards</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">with retreating angles</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 5, 11</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">exercitus in cornua, sinuatā mediā parte, curvatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Vit. Beat. 4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Vit. Beat. 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Chaucorum gens) donec in Chattos usque sinuetur,</quote> <trans><tr>extends in a curve</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ionia se ambagibus sinuat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:17" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oceanum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Rapt. Pros. 1, 271</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n44415.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to hollow out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">excavate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">adhuc sana rodendo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:2:section=21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 7, 2, § 21</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sinuose: <entryFree id="n44416" type="main" key="si^nu^o_se_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĭnŭōsē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. sinuosus <sense id="n44416.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
sinuosus: <entryFree id="n44417" type="main" key="si^nu^o_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĭnŭōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>1. sinus</etym>, <sense id="n44417.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of bendings</hi>, <hi rend="ital">windings</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">curves; full of folds</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">winding</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sinuous</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in postAug. prose; syn. tortuosus). </sense><sense id="n44417.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">flexus anguis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:244" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 244</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">volumina (serpentis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:753" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 11, 753</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Maeander flexibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 29, 31, § 113</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arcus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:1:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 1, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vela,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 1, 15; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:8:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 8, 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 5, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">folia lateribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 6, 8, § 19</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n44417.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n44417.3" n="A" level="2"> Of style, <hi rend="ital">full of digressions</hi>, <hi rend="ital">diffuse</hi>: ratio narrandi, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:4:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 4, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaestio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:14:2:13" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 14, 2, 13</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n44417.4" n="B" level="2"> Sinuoso in pectore, <hi rend="ital">in the recesses of my heart</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:5:27" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 5, 27</bibl>.—* <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">sĭnŭōsē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">intricately</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in a roundabout manner</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicere sinuosius atque sollertius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:12:5:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 12, 5, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sinus: <entryFree id="n44418" type="main" key="si^nus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĭnus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <sense id="n44418.0" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">a bent surface</hi> (raised or depressed), <hi rend="ital">a curve</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fold</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a hollow</hi>, etc. (so mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in postAug. prose): draco ... conficiens sinus e corpore flexos, <hi rend="ital">folds</hi>, <hi rend="ital">coils</hi>, Cic. poët. N. D. 2, 42, 106; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:689" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 689</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">15, 721</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sinu ex togā facto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 18 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—Of <hi rend="ital">the bag</hi> of a fishing-net: <cit><quote lang="la">quando abiit rete pessum, tum adducit sinum (piscator),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:1:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 1, 1, 15</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:4:41" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 4, 41</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">and of a hunter's net,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:13:100" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 13, 100</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Grat.</author> Cyn. 29</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">also of a spider's web,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 24, 28, § 82</bibl></cit>.—Of <hi rend="ital">the bend</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belly</hi> of a sail swollen by the wind: <cit><quote lang="la">velorum plenos subtrahis ipse sinus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:9" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 9</bibl></cit> (4, 8), 30; <cit><quote lang="la">and so with or without velum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:3:38" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 3, 38</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:455" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 455</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 831</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:500" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 500</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:472" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 6, 472</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:7:242" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 7, 242</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:7:23" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 7, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:37 al" default="NO">12, 10, 37 al.</bibl>—Of hair, <hi rend="ital">a curl</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ringlet</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut fieret torto flexilis orbe sinus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:14:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 14, 26</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:148" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 3, 148</bibl>.— Of <hi rend="ital">the curve</hi> of a reaping-hook: <cit><quote lang="la">falcis ea pars, quae flectitur, sinus nominatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:25:1 sq" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 25, 1 sq.</bibl></cit>—Of bones, <hi rend="ital">a sinus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">umeri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 8, 1 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">ulceris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 2 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suppurationis ferro recisae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:11:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 11, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> 4, 9, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44418.1" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n44418.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The hanging fold of the upper part of the toga</hi>, about the breast, <hi rend="ital">the bosom</hi> of a garment; also <hi rend="ital">the bosom</hi> of a person; sometimes also <hi rend="ital">the lap</hi> (= gremium, the predom. class. signif.; esp. freq. in a trop. sense). </sense><sense id="n44418.3" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">est aliquid in amictu: quod ipsum aliquatenus temporum condicione mutatum est. Nam veteribus nulli sinus, perquam breves post illos fuerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:137" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 137</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">decentissimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:140 sq" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 140 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Caesar moriens) sinistrā manu sinum ad ima crura deduxit, quo honestius caderet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:82" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 82</bibl></cit> (for which, of the same: <cit><quote lang="la">togam manu demisit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:4:5:6" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 4, 5, 6</bibl></cit>); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:6:18" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 6, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">praetextae sinus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:5" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne admissum quidem quemquam senatorum nisi solum et praetentato sinu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:35" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut conchas legerent galeasque et sinus replerent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:46" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cedo mihi ex ipsius sinu litteras Syracusanorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:57:section=147" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 57, § 147</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aurum in sinu ejus invenerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:1:30" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 1, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paternos In sinu ferens deos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:18:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 18, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nuda genu, nodoque sinus collecta fluentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:320" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 320</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et fluit effuso cui toga laxa sinu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:6:14" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 6, 14</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">micat igneus ostro, Undantemque sinum nodis irrugat Iberis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:4:265" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 4, 265</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad haec, quae a fortunā sparguntur, sinum expandit,</quote> <trans><tr>eagerly embraces</tr>, <tr>grasps</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 74:6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 74, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid velut magnum bonum intra sinum continere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Vit. Beat. 23:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vit. Beat. 23, 3</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sinum subducere alicui rei,</quote> <trans><tr>to reject</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Thyest. 430" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Thyest. 430</bibl></cit>.—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">sinu laxo (i. e. soluto) ferre aliquid,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to be careless about a thing</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:172" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 172</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n44418.4" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n44418.5" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">The purse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">money</hi>, which was carried in the bosom of the toga (cf. supra, the passage, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:1:30" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 1, 30</bibl>, and v. crumena; <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">semper amatorum ponderat illa sinus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:16" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 16</bibl></cit> (3, 8), 12: <cit><quote lang="la">quo pretium condat, non habet ille sinum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 10</bibl></cit>, <cb n="SINU" /> 18: <cit><quote lang="la">aere sinus plenos urbe reportare, Col. poët. 10, 310: plurium sinum ac domum inplere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 6:43:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 6, 43, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui etiam condemnationes in sinum vertisse dicuntur ... praedam omnem in sinum contulit,</quote> <trans><tr>into his purse</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Commod. 14 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">avaritiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:88" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 1, 88</bibl></cit>.—Hence, M. Scaurus Marianis sodaliciis rapinarum provincialium sinus, <hi rend="ital">the pocketer</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">the receiver</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 15, 24, § 116</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 92 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 14</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44418.6" n="(b)" level="5"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a garment</hi>, in gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">Tyrio prodeat apta sinu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:9:72" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 9, 72</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:6:18" default="NO">1, 6, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">auratus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:310" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 310</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">purpureus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:5:28" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regalis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:13:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 13, 36</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 71</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:2:1:133" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 2, 1, 133</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44418.7" n="(g)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">The bosom</hi> of a person: <cit><quote lang="la">manum in sinum alicui Inserere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 3, 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gelu rigentem colubram sinu fovit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:4:17:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 4, 17, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opposuit sinum Antonius stricto ferro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scortum in sinu consulis recubans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tangitur, et tacto concipit illa sinu, i. e. utero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:256" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 256</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">usque metu micuere sinus, dum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:1:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 1, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">horum in sinum omnia congerebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:45" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 45</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44418.8" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n44418.9" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">The bosom</hi>, as in most other languages, for <hi rend="ital">love</hi>, <hi rend="ital">protection</hi>, <hi rend="ital">asylum</hi>, etc. (usu. in the phrases in sinu esse, habere, etc.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn. gremium): hic non amandus? hiccine non gestandus in sinu est?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:5:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 5, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iste vero sit in sinu semper et complexu meo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:14:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 14, 4, 3</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">postremum genus proprium est Catilinae, de ejus delectu, immo vero de complexu ejus ac sinu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:10:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 2, 10, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suo sinu complexuque aliquem recipere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:13:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 13, 4, 9</bibl></cit>; so (with complexus) <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 25, 61</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Pompeius), mihi crede, in sinu est,</quote> <trans><tr>is very dear to me</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:13:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 13, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Bibulum noli dimittere e sinu tuo,</quote> <trans><tr>from your intimacy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,059:1:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ad Brut. 1, 7, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praesertim si in amici sinu defieas,</quote> <trans><tr>on the bosom</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:8:16:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 8, 16, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in hujus sinu indulgentiāque educatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 4</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 28</bibl>; cf.: etsi commotus ingenio, simulationum tamen falsa in sinu avi perdidicerat, i. e. <hi rend="ital">under the care</hi> or <hi rend="ital">tuition</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 6, 45 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">confugit in sinum tuum concussa respublica,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>into your arms</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:6:3" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 6, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:8:12:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 8, 12, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">optatum negotium sibi in sinum delatum esse dicebat,</quote> <trans><tr>committed to his guardianship</tr>, <tr>care</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:50:section=131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 50, § 131</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:45:2" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 45, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">respublica in Vespasiani sinum cessisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 69</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:22:3:27" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 22, 3, 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sinum praebere tam alte cadenti,</quote> <trans><tr>protection</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 3:23:6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 3, 23, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44418.10" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">The interior</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the inmost part</hi> of a thing: <cit><quote lang="la">alii intra moenia atque in sinu urbis sunt hostes,</quote> <trans><tr>in the midst</tr>, <tr>in the heart of the city</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 52:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 52, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in urbe ac sinu cavendum hostem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 38</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:4:34" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 4, 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:6:652" default="NO">6, 652</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Eutr. 2, 575</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut (hostis) fronte simul et sinu exciperetur,</quote> <trans><tr>in the centre</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in intimo sinu pacis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>in the midst of a profound peace</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:56:4" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 56, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44418.11" n="c" level="4"> In sinu alicujus, <hi rend="ital">in the power</hi> or <hi rend="ital">possession of</hi> (postAug. and rare): <cit><quote lang="la">opes Cremonensium in sinu praefectorum fore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnem fortunam in sinu meo habui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:22:3:27" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 22, 3, 27</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n44418.12" n="d" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">A hiding-place</hi>, <hi rend="ital">place of concealment</hi>: ut in sinu gaudeant, gloriose loqui desinunt, qs. <hi rend="ital">in their bosoms</hi> (or, as we say, <hi rend="ital">in their sleeve</hi>), i. e. <hi rend="ital">in secret</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:21:51" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 21, 51</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">so of secret joy,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:4:13:8" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 4, 13, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in tacito cohibe gaudia clausa sinu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:25" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 25</bibl></cit> (3, 20), 30; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 105:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 105, 3</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also: plaudere in sinum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pudic. 6</bibl></cit>: suum potius cubiculum ac sinum offerre contegendis quae, etc., <hi rend="ital">the secrecy</hi> or <hi rend="ital">concealment of her bed-chamber</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">abditis pecuniis per occultos aut ambitiosos sinus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>in hidingplaces offered by obscurity or by high rank</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 2, 92</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44418.13" n="e" level="4"> Sinus Abrahae, <hi rend="ital">the place of the spirits of the just</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">sinum Abrahae, regionem non caelestem, sublimiorem tamen Inferis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 4, 34</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n44418.14" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A bay</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bight</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gulf</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut primum ex alto sinus ab litore ad urbem inflectitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:12:section=30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 12, § 30</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">portus infusi in sinus oppidi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:31:43" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 3, 31, 43</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 3, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:11:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Imp. Pomp. 11, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:56:section=145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 56, § 145</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 16, 6, 1</bibl>; * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 78:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 78, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 43, 44, § 114</bibl> (Jahn, nivibus); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:98" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 98</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:243" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 243</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 132</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:33:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 33, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:10:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epod. 10, 19</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44418.15" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n44418.16" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">The land lying on a gulf</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a point of land</hi> that helps to form it (perh. not ante-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">segetibus in sinu Aenianum vastatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 5</bibl></cit> Drak.: <cit><quote lang="la">jam in sinum Maliacum venerat (with an army),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 37, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 3, 66</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 8, 8, § 23</bibl>; Just. <pb n="1710" /> <cb n="SIQU" /> 2, 4, 26; 24, 4, 3.—</sense><sense id="n44418.17" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">A curve</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fold in land</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a basin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hollow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">valley</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Arpini terra campestri agro in ingentem sinum consedit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 2, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">subito dehiscit terra, et immenso sinu laxata patuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Oedip. 582" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Oedip. 582</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Fur. 679" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Herc. Fur. 679</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 44, 44, § 115</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">jugum montis velut sinu quodam flexuque curvatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:4:6" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 4, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">montium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:9:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 9, 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
<entryFree id="n44419" type="main" key="si_nus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sīnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, v. sinum.</entryFree>
sion: <entryFree id="n44420" type="main" key="si^on1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĭon</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">si/on</foreign>, <sense id="n44420.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">water - parsley</hi>: Sium latifolium, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 8, 56, § 88</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:84" default="NO" valid="yes">22, 22, 41, § 84</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n44421" type="main" key="Si_on2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sīon</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype> (or <itype>indecl.</itype>), <gen>m.</gen>, <gen>f.</gen>, or <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n44421.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a hill of Jerusalem</hi>, and, by meton., <hi rend="ital">Jerusalem</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Ham. 459</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:21:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Matt. 21, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">facta est deserta Sion,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:64:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Isa. 64, 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
siparium: <entryFree id="n44422" type="main" key="si_pa^ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sīpărĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>kindr. with supparum, from <foreign lang="greek">si/paros</foreign>, orig. a little sail; hence, transf.</etym>, <sense id="n44422.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The smaller curtain in a theatre</hi> (drawn up between the scenes of a comedy; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">aulaeum, the main curtain): aulaeo subducto et complicitis sipariis, scena disponitur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 10, p. 253, 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1</bibl>, p. 106, 4: <cit><quote lang="la">post siparium,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>behind the scenes</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Prov. Cons. 6, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:186" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 186</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44422.1" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">comedy</hi> (opp. cothurnus, tragedy): <cit><quote lang="la">(verba) cothurno, non tantum sipario fortiora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Tranq. 11:6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Tranq. 11, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n44422.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A curtain</hi> or <hi rend="ital">screen over the judges' seats</hi> to keep off the sun, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:1:32" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 1, 32</bibl> Spald.; 6, 3, 72.</sense></entryFree>
siparum: <entryFree id="n44423" type="main" key="sipa^rum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sipărum</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-us</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. supparum.</entryFree>
siphae: <entryFree id="n44424" type="main" key="Siphae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Siphae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n44424.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city of Bœotia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the borders of Phocis</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 3, 4, § 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
siphnius: <entryFree id="n44425" type="main" key="Siphni^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Siphnĭus</orth>, v. Siphnus <sense id="n44425.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
siphnus: <entryFree id="n44426" type="main" key="Siphnus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Siphnus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-os</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n44426.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one of the Cyclades</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Sifano</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:7" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 12, 22, § 66</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:159" default="NO" valid="yes">36, 22, 44, § 159</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Siphnĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Siphnian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lapis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:159" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 22, 44, § 159</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sipho: <entryFree id="n44427" type="greek" key="si_pho"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sīpho</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">-on</orth>; in many MSS. also written <orth extent="full" lang="la">sīfo</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">si/fwn</foreign> (a small pipe). <sense id="n44427.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A siphon</hi> (called also diabetes): <cit><quote lang="la">sipho, quem diabeten vocant mechanici,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:10:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 10, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:14:15" default="NO">9, 14, 15</bibl>; Lucil. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:8:23" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 8, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 2:16" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 2, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:166" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 65, 66, § 166</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:124" default="NO" valid="yes">32, 10, 42, § 124</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:7:156" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 7, 156</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:310" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 310</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n44427.1" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A little pipe to suck drinks through</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a drinking-tube</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 1, 8 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—</sense><sense id="n44427.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A kind of fireengine</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:33:7:12:section=18" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 33, 7, 12, § 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:10:42:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 10, 42, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> 20, 6, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
siphunculus: <entryFree id="n44428" type="main" key="si_phuncu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sīphuncŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>sipho</etym>, <sense id="n44428.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little pipe from which water springs forth</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:6:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 6, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:6:36" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 6, 36</bibl>.—Also written without the aspirate, <orth extent="full" lang="la">sīpuncŭlus</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1248,001:, Or. 1" default="NO"><author>Fronto</author>, Or. 1 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
sipo: <entryFree id="n44429" type="main" key="sipo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sipo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, v. supo.</entryFree>
sipolindrum: <entryFree id="n44430" type="main" key="sipolindrum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sipolindrum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. cepolindrum.</entryFree>
sipontum: <entryFree id="n44431" type="main" key="Si_pontum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sīpontum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*sipou=s</foreign> (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 6, 2, 3</bibl>), <sense id="n44431.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an important maritime town in Appulia</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">S. Maria di Siponto</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:4:7" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 4, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 11, 16, § 103</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:15:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 15, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">10, 7, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:45:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 45, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:23:3 al" default="NO" valid="yes">39, 23, 3 al.</bibl> (in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:24:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 24, 4</bibl> dub., v. Weissenb. ad h.l.).—In a Greek form, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sīpūs</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:635" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 635</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:5:377" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 5, 377</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Sipontum, aut ut Graii dixere, Sipus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:4:7" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 4, 7</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sīpontīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Sipontum</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Sipontian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">siccitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:27:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 27, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">POPVLVS,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Murat.</author> p. 1081, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
siptachora: <entryFree id="n44432" type="foreign" key="siptacho^ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">siptachŏra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>Indian</etym>, <sense id="n44432.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a tree in India that yields amber;</hi> in Ctesias, <foreign lang="greek">siptaxo/ra</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 2, 11, § 39</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
